rqJN7TtZva164v0QUtFURw.text: The hubby and I came here for dinner on a Saturday night while we're visiting Edinburgh, Scotland. This place was kind of hidden in a small ally on the royal mile. We ran into it quite by accident while we were walking around the Royal mile. It was so busy on friday night we couldn't get a table, so we made a reservation for Saturday night to come back. We were so glad we came back. The place had a very lively energy with all kinds of people eating and drinking here. I had the steak and fries and the hubby had chicken. The dishes seem simple enough, but it was executed perfectly. My steak was cooked perfectly at midum rare, and had tons of flavor, even the fries were done really well. The thick cut fries were crispy on the outside and fluffy and flavorful on the inside. The grilled chicken was equally delicious with tender and juicy meat complimented by delicious veggies. I asked the waiter to recommend a cocktail with whisky and he recommended 'the running man', since I liked fruity cocktails. It was a spot on recommendation.   Overall, it was such a great dining experience, we will definitely come back when visit Edinburgh again.

eur6oqNo9NEnDEjqlBtyPg.text: Definitely worth a visit! Located precisely underneath our window, we decided to give it a go on the way back to the hotel, after a whole day of sightseeing. And what a good idea that was! Saturday evening, no reservation and yet, the super friendly staff managed to seat us upstairs. The food was delicious but the cocktail selection was a delight! Grilled haloumi cheese & watermelon starter was excellent and so was the vegetable carpaccio. Light, yet super tasty - perfect introduction to our mains. Both, the pork fillet and the mallet were cooked to perfection, beautifully plated and delicious. However, the cocktails were the stars of our evening. We had several and could not agree on a favorite one, so I guess we need to come back :) The upstairs eating area is much calmer than the bar and lets you have a conversation. Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Carpaccio
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Unusual Suspect

uWsfJgg4zCXDWjiKA8_TNg.text: Food is great but don't get any starters. You'll spoil your appetite and they WILL NOT give you a to-go box. They, um, don't have them. I've been to places much nicer than this and they all offer to-go boxes. These guys apparently love to waste food and hurt the environment to stroke their pretentious egos. Whatever...

5Bk-60jzu0z9FtfXHB6qWw.text: Great experience! We were thankful to get a table for 6. Food and drink were excellent. Highlights were the haggis app, lamb rump and bbq ribs.

FxJVWI-JZyhXZsXX70CMmw.text: Really good appetizers and drinks very centrally located in the old town. Really cool ambiance . Will definitely recommend to friends coming to Edinburgh.

Lqh3qTUZ0ybt2EffJ3Er0w.text: Loved the character and pathway to arrive at this neat dining spot.  We started our dining experience with truffle potato chips (aka American version of fries), yummy!  For our entrees, we ordered the pork chops and breaded squash with cashews, green and chickpeas. Both were equally delicious!

X73wVgDYhuDyhfscS-1ZzQ.text: Pub is located downstairs and dining tables are available on both floors as well as outdoors. Enjoyed a flavorful dinner meal and cocktail/beer. Romantic lighting and atmosphere.

Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish curry

i42cb6g-_h9SllVEy4e9UA.text: First stop in Edinburgh after checking into our hotel. Super cute place. Quaint, cozy with just enough historical ambiance to be cool but not pretentious.   They seated us right away for dinner even without reservations. We got there at 6pm on a Tuesday night. Maybe we were just lucky.  Very friendly and warm staff. Food was awesome. Probably one of our best meals thus far in the UK. I had the delcious perfectly seasoned succulent pork belly. Fat never tasted so good.   My friend had the lamb dish. Perfectly prepared and paired with fresh tomatoes and potatoes.  Whiskey selection is wide and far (local to the States to Japan). Pages and pages of it. Loved it.   Would definitely recommend this to friends near and far. Just make reservations ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pork belly dish. Yummy!!

YnmBr2ZFzn6cO6maoKzaAA.text: The Devil's Advocate was recommended to us as a great place to grab a drink after dinner.  We stopped in for a few pints and the bartenders were very friendly.   There isn't much seating, so we just hung out by the bar which worked out perfectly. They also serve food here however we did not indulge.    The atmosphere was a bit chic, low lighting etc which was enjoyable.  After a few pints we were on our way back home.   I would like to come back and try some of the food as it seems like it would be quite enjoyable.

kBuxtTIkF-lUSpApWEIiLg.text: Everything I hoped for in reading of this restaurant on Yelp. The lamb was amazing, flavorful and generous in portion. I started with a carrot-herb soup that was warming on this cold day. Overall great experience

oGlec2sUeVnLNk8wo39Rig.text: Hidden gem! to kick off our Scotch adventure. The pork and venison were A1and the whisky cocktails were top notch. Definitely worth a stop. Seems like a place the locals go. Collin one of the bartenders made a wonderful cocktail with laphroiag not on the menu.  Truffle fries were on point and there haggis potato soup well made.  Atmosphere was happening, make sure u reserve a spot since dining is limited.  We were lucky to get in for a quick dinner before the reservations came in.

Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Truffle fries, pork chops and venison oh and their house ale.

WibWY5hwSOlrPtuoqff9-g.text: This is exactly the place we'd hoped to find. Great local beer on draft, and we made a dinner of three starters. Love the atmosphere. The service was attentive without being overbearing. Eat here. Drink here. You'll be glad you did.

Ms-HxQlUNhiKQcZcGX0Epg.text: Such a cosy nook (or perch, if you prefer!) Dim, swanky atmosphere and incredible comfort food. Wicked strong drinks and very friendly staff :)

pD9_ENAHBP3kKuiLKJVSsA.text: Ice selection of spirits and beer. You can enjoy at the bar or take to the patio. Dinner is a limited menu but the beet risotto was well done. Make sure you have time as the staff is friendly but not rushed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

tWDPf86FBmFRKHgyFjKKCQ.text: Love this place! It's got a great feel - lots of wood and stone. The cocktail list is superb and they have a good selection of beers as well.   I ordered Jerusalem Artichoke soup and it was to die for. Pure deliciousness. Also had a side of roasted seasonal vegetables and they were divine.   This place seems to be pretty popular, so I recommend booking a reservation in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Early grey, vodka, egg white and more - absolutely delicious
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The House Advocate... Look at that scrumptious blueberry!

m-gzxH2_yLbRnCLXaeOCjQ.text: There is a reason Devil's Advocate has such good Yelp reviews. This place is cute, cool, kind of hidden and has a really nice ambiance and menu. The booths in little hidden alcoves makes having intimate conversation with friends much easier and the darker mood lighting is a nice touch.   I came here with some friends for a girls night with food and drinks. The drink menu is pretty eclectic and has some really interesting options. The server had some good off-menu suggestions and everything we had was very good. One thing we did notice though is that the drink/price ratio is pretty bad. All our drinks came in tiny, fancy cocktail glasses of various forms. While adorable, this makes for about three sips before your drink is gone and you are looking around for another. The food was similarly good and eclectic, but small portions that were hard to share and didnt go far.   Aside from the cost ratio, the only other real downside I see to DA is that service wasnt always the fastest. We waited for drinks a lot via table service, which seemed silly when we were three steps from the bar. The food came out pretty quickly, but it you wanted to get your server's attention for anything they were difficult to track down. Same deal with getting and paying the bill.   Overall a nice place, great drinks, food and ambiance. Will definitely return, just dont be in a rush and be prepared to lay down some cash.

9yaFMOkuDHMCUnTl0GEbGA.text: LOVED.  4:30 on a Tuesday provided Great ambiance and a diverse crowd of locals - just a few tourists.  Would be a local favorite if I lived in Edinburgh.  Charcuterie cheese and meat plate was just right.  Prices were very reasonable!

GJsM3bMzj3bO8L9kypVaKg.text: This was possibly one of the best meals I've ever eaten in my life.  It was a dark, freezing rainy night, and my very first time in Scotland so the drama factor alone of trying to find this restaurant down a dark spooky close added to the fun of going.   I had a wonderful spicy tomato soup to start and then a venison dish as my main and both were out of this world.   I had a great little table upstairs that overlooked the downstairs bar and it was fun to people watch and see so many happy, vibrant people enjoying a night out during the festive season.  If you are in Edinburgh, do yourself a big favor and make this a key stop in your culinary adventure.   You won't regret it.

ERlUpOwMW_Jk3rorL1apnw.text: Best chips ever. Amazing drinks! Try the Black Dog (smoked strawberries) or the Man Overboard (tastes like Christmas) for starters! They are a bit on the pricey side, but oh, so delicious! The staff is extremely friendly as well! :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The chocolate torte has CARAMEL on the bottom. Served with ice cream.

jd7wJBdxKo7_yF05awSz6g.text: I happily stumbled upon The Devil's Advocate on a cold night while famished and I highly recommend it; the food was delicious and the staff was super friendly. Everyone made awesome recommendations and created an environment that is fun and easy to be in. I would have easily returned if my time in Edinburgh wasn't so limited, but I think it says a lot that a lot of my local friends recommended I go there.

6s18Wz9veWXw4SVRNrJ7sA.text: I love this place. Good food, good selection of drinks, adorable hipster waiting staff who are happy to give recommendations. I think a beard might be a requirement for employment here.

-m7uJ6HCV-vKtw6byw8nhQ.text: I had the Lamb Burger, and it was very good.  They also have a large selection of Whiskeys, and did a very good job of finding one they thought I would like (my knowledge of whiskey is limited) and I very much enjoyed their recommendation.  The place was friendly, clean, and the price of drinks was very reasonable. The only reason I don't give this place 5 stars is that the price of lamb burger seemed step at 14 pounds when compared to some other very good burger places such as Holyrood 9A.

ts37GUYVyiv8slH_lMTXxA.text: Fantastic food and atmosphere with friendly and attentive service. The lamb burger with beet root tatziki and goat cheese was AMAZING.

et8iXmX9pbC8RJj619Nkxg.text: Loved this secluded spot right off the main touristy drag. It feels romantic and magical with elegant lighting and two-level layout. Also, good selection of beers on tap. Excellent food. Great service.

sIbdPvEAGiJmsg_sEvINsA.text: Not a whiskey drinker but wanted to try this place because of its reviews and location. First, make a reservation. This is a very busy place. We did and we were so happy with the beautiful booth upstairs. The decor is warm and inviting. Good cocktails. Though not an extensive menu, it was filled with such interesting offerings. Small but tasty appetizers. Especially liked the cod main dish. The chicken tagliatelle and roasted garlic gnocchi were good not great. Definitely worth a visit.

kqFTvW2xknvATwU-rIeneA.text: Loved this place.  Such a great find and one of my all time favorite restaurants.  Drinks incredible.  I had the lamb burger and was very pleased.  Staff was very friendly and the ambience was the kicker.  Old world charm and tastefully designed.  This is a must for anyone in the area.

pRSBsePJCQRjWY7JnTjEUw.text: Unfortunately, we were not able to get in for dinner as they book up days in advance, but stopped in for a couple drinks. The atmosphere and decor is simply amazing. It feels like you've stepped back in time a couple hundred years. Also, the cocktails are divine. Try the Rose on St. James. We will definitely be back for dinner next time we are in Edinburgh.

-fr5QamtvJw86Q-J-tTCdQ.text: After having discovered the awkward way that there was no toilet paper in the men's bathroom, my party of 1 was turned away for food at 1945 on a Wednesday night because "the kitchen doesn't have the capacity". Not put on a wait list, but turned away.

PzMEVsHY-OAMEA3Wog6a1w.text: We really liked this place. We were on vacation in Edinburgh, and found this spot down a really cool little medieval alley. We're a family of four with high school aged kids, and we found great food and a great vibe. The place is alive. Remember to have your kids bring their ID, and then they can try some great Scottish brews. My 18 year old liked Caeser Augustus, only available in Scotland (we were later sad to discover). The parents will enjoy the whisky.

DX2-ahrrJqXsvgHk00uG7Q.text: This place is annoyingly hipster, and the waitstaff are all too cool to smile or be friendly, but the food and atmosphere are so so good. I had the duck leg confit and my husband had the ox cheek and both were cooked perfectly and delicious to the last bite. It was one of the best meals we had the entire time we were in Edinburgh.

FugPArCYRYkxzY5pp2DdsA.text: This place is the spot if you enjoy crafted cocktails paired with delectable plates. Reminds me of an old time prohibition style bar.  Friendly service, great recommendations from the staff.  The traditional old fashioned was one of the best.  If we ever come back to Edinburgh, we will surely stop by here again.  Cheers!

3_umYUSk5TJ0Sqmgdi5SjQ.text: Our meal was fine, but nothing very special. Convenient location in the city and a nice ambiance once inside. We had an drinks, an appetizer, and two mains which were okay, but didn't live up to the premium prices. Our service was unfortunately poor. Friendly wait-staff, but they seemed overwhelmed and weren't around when needed.

xTp-o4V16S-8LYRsL4V4sQ.text: I love this venue. It's got an imaginative cocktail selection with a few old favourites contrasted with other bizarre concoctions - as any decent cocktail bar should. The wine selection is also fantastic & the gent serving us obliged us with some small tasters in advance of our final choice. I have not yet had anything that constitutes even the slightest bit of bad service & therefore continue to return to this favourite spot frequently. I'd put this forward as a cosy spot for the winter season

HIMmsmvmwD_8qYXaKPxh2g.text: Denied entry on a Saturday night because the place was 'too busy'. Unfortunately, the bouncer forgot the bar has floor to ceiling glass windows at the front which told us the bar was particularly quiet for a Saturday night, especially following two groups of four leaving before us. Suspect there is a certain crowd the place is after...just not sure what that is.

p66ZdaQySUMZve9MmALwRg.text: Go down the close to this awesome restaurant and bar. Make sure to call in for a reservation the day before, or just drop in for a drink. Great food and an awesome vibe to the site. Just off the Royal Mile in a close. Prices are a bit high, (anything on or around the Royal Mile is), but food and service along with the atmosphere are worth it.

NSTCWBehM5b4cZh3fu_P8g.text: Great meal here!  They were able to accommodate a big party during the busy festival season, which was awesome. Food was great, and a nice wine list too.  Location on a quiet alley was fun and made it feel like it was hidden from the crowds (even though the restaurant was full).  Staff members were patient and nice.

vuLP2-2rbbDBwY28s2NrNQ.text: Great place. Perfect atmosphere. I loved the Caesar salad, precisely the right combination of ingredients.  Poached pear for dessert is an absolute hit. Espresso finished it off.

j4kRWJfYhm5P--mW5UZZFA.text: They hosted an amazing yelp party, and the place is gorgeous. I will have to say because of the amazing yelp people, the yelp cake, and endless prosecco my review is a bit out of the ordinary. But the bartenders were cute and quick, the ambience was candlelight,  perfect for a romantic night out. And it was romantic!

Y22WVMf6Y9fy_UxejXj6-w.text: Looked fun! Great bar! Go down the steps at the Advocate off The Royal Mile. There was a two hour wait so we did not get to eat here. I gave it a five for atmosphere!

_OATVAWaskrvQwt5smoY-w.text: Cool new bar down Advocates Close!! I love the look and feel of the place. It looks like it has lots of potential so I'll look forward to going back again on a weekend night, or day. An exciting new bar to go to in the Old Town. From the sounds of it they're going to be opening up mega early for breakfast so I'll have to try it sometime.

tm8_AWWYkMs5rIXYOP0Fvg.text: Great time, food and drinks and atmosphere  Definitely make a reservation if you want to eat

2e7Kb8-88A0OOEpuqhlbNA.text: Great atmosphere, tucked away in a secluded close, and good food.   You really get the  Edinburgh experience here.  The fish and chips are excellent.

-F2ZtH_FTEsk8liOJ7GW8A.text: Incredible, absolutely my favorite restaraunt we visited while in Edinburgh. Great service, awesome drinks and even BETTER food!! Located off of Advocate's Close down the Royal Mile, we stumbled upon this place while walking to new town. They bar area is large with plenty of room to stand either at the bar while waiting or at a smaller high top. Very cool selection of house cocktails and the bartenders seemed to be able to whip different things up off the top of their heads as well!!   We were seated on the ground floor in a somewhat private booth. 3 of us split a charcuterie board of excellent selections of meats and cheeses and oil. I got the pan roasted pork chop with chorizo and sweet potato puree and it was by far one of the best meals I've had in months. Everything on their menu looked and smelled incredible from what we saw. I will 100% be returning to this place when we return!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3EirKf_bThQ9z9kUlUITJw.text: Great venue, but be prepared for a hike. Last visit we made the mistake of coming here later in the night (meaning more drinks in) and boys was the climb back up an experience  Anywho, the environment is warm and inviting as is the staff. Expect to pay about 10pound/drink and also expect to enjoy every sip of it. Cheers!

dJcBw1M4eYSXCQrOT5XMKQ.text: Great distinctive food! My unreserved two thumbs up! Portions were substantial for both the starters and the mains. Service was outstanding. Water glasses were refilled in a timely manner, a key service requirement.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

CtrvBJon02AAjhyyQuGnbQ.text: First tip--make a reservation for sure if you want food. We stopped by on Friday and were told they were booked solid. We called that night and they only had two tables left for dinner service Saturday.  We were sat at one of the three tables downstairs by the restroom--we didn't mind, as it wasn't noisy or smelly, and our server was attentive the entire night.  We ordered two cocktails, both of which were good. For starters, we went with the soup of the day (cauliflower and onion), the terrine and cheese board, and the sauteed spinach and mushrooms with garlic puree. Everything was absolutely delicious. Scraped the soup bowl clean with the sourdough bread.  For mains, my partner got the lamb rump, and I got the pork chop with pancetta, cabbage, sweet potato puree and roast apple. We also got a side of parmesan truffle chips. Again, so good. My partner finished his whole plate and some of mine. I was able to box up leftovers.   It was fairly pricey meal but it was really satisfying and tasty. Definitely recommend giving this place a go.

Xc179XMBJCFVRUhzSrb1IA.text: Oh my god. Best burger I've had in ages. For real. It's been a couple weeks but I'm still fondly reminiscing on the time I spent in the company of that beautiful hunk of beef.  I had just arrived in Edinburgh and was hungry. After chatting with my Airbnb host, she agreed that she'd heard good things about The Devil's Advocate (I had already bookmarked it on Yelp). My accommodation was right down the street. It's in the middle of Advocate Close, so you either need to walk up or down a bunch of steps, dependent on which direction you're coming from.  I walked down and asked about seating for one. The bartender suggested the bar, which suited me just fine. I was quickly given a porter (taste before full pour) and ordered the burger.  Here's a testament to how good it was: I didn't realize it had peppers on it. I ate them anyway even though I despise peppers in most instances. Because they complemented the flavoring so well. The whole thing was just so good. I think my picture of it tells it all.  One meh point: It was an expensive burger. But you're paying for top quality.  I wholeheartedly recommend this place and am accepting burger donations.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Porter
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

cvvQ34r4XPvVdQpo4syRgw.text: Wonderful place, limited seating. I'd recommend calling in a reservation. My wife and I walked in and waited an hour for seating. They were kind enough to have heaters and blankets available outside.  Great selection of wine as well as whisky.  The menu was superb. I had the lamb, wife had the pork chop. Top notch!

nU_8W9sN9mcB4SnMmhVgHw.text: Just loved this place! Service is amazing, whisky menu with hundreds of great options, very good Scottish food.

cAkVnZ86hKfMVCjFwBAJcw.text: Exciting bistro down stone steps below royal mile.attractive stone interior first the bar then up to dining.menu selection Lamb to pastas.3 various presentations charcuterie boards are easy to share and can make an entire meal.service is great and not cloying.my favorite is the large selection of whiskey sorted by source and served for about 7pounds.

fd7bLbVr0j1I210FsDtCuA.text: Great place to have drinks or a dinner. Reservation highly recommended (or go early). Very popular restaurant. Great food and great service. High recommended

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

SSwsMN94cxbFvFljFcpKNw.text: Very nice place for lunch or dinner, right off the royal mile, and the food was great. Not at all touristy. Highly recommended.

kJUMtWuUAuBqIcsF3dX3AQ.text: I come here everyone I'm in town for work. The vibe is amazing. Employees are lovely. Everything I've ever order is spot in and always amazing. Don't leave Edinburgh without stopping in here!! Make reservations for dinner!

OCdxX1-LOEO0YqoQViJnUw.text: Most expensive restaurant I went to when I visited Edinburgh, but also the most delicious!   The restaurant has a lively ambiance, almost noisy. It's also really dim inside, but I suppose that enhances the vibe. They are well known for their drinks, so definitely order one (or two) at the bar.   I ordered the chicken pasta and it was just divine. The truffle oil was the best part of it.   For dessert, I got a whiskey sour sorbet with poached pear. Hands down the best sorbet I've ever had. I also love how it was artfully garnished with white chocolate pieces and raspberries.   Despite my meal costing me a pretty penny, I would absolutely return. The flavorful dishes make it well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

G6eHjptuRVikoK889vhUEw.text: Nianh, Givan( don't know if I spelled it right  ) and Ronney were serving us here. They were so lovely and helpful. They were all recommended amazing cocktails and food.  Food is so lovely with great ambience. Highly recommended!  Try their whiskey and princess and the pea cocktail  very unique and sooooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Jazz
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Princess and the Pea
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Jazz

ufWmiPQ_5C_JT0M3yZ8xGg.text: The food was good and they were accommodating to dietary restrictions but down to 3 stars for the horrible service. Over 15 minutes for acknowledgement, another 20 minutes after menus dropped off to order and then over 30 minutes before we could flag someone down to get the check.

oRODWDWyIcO9lSZPR3t2Eg.text: Hmmm....   It's a very well done room, very upmarket hipster. Staff is friendly - with lots of handsome beardy bartenders.  Food is quite good, but doesn't quite manage to transcend to greatness.  Service is generally good if somewhat unfocused - five different servers over the course of our meal - so no bond of hospitality with your server happening here, and they're very busy, so despite what you'll charitably credit as their best efforts, don't expect a lot of love.    Overall a positive experience, but it seems like the kind of place where your table assignment is partly based on simple availability, but you can't help but feel like tables are awarded based on how beautiful you are. Apparently we should be happy that we got a table and accept that we're just not as beautiful as those people who didn't have a reservation but got seated on the patio regardless - if this kind of thing makes you crazy, this is not your place.  If you're looking to be seen in a happening restaurant then you'll love it.

PYcH3dSHP7xC-Sjm7c9lzA.text: Had the smoked fish platter. Smoked salmon was good but the rest was just ok. Would take something else.  Had the fried haggis; was good but nothing amazing. It had peppers on the side; nothing special.  Had the orzo with goat cheese and peas. By far the best thing we ate! Cocktails were good. Ambiance is nice.

clqE65VzBz2M2Jbtr2VqZw.text: Excellent restaurant food was superb! Had the cod and side of truffle fries and they were unbelievable. Great scotch selection and tasty deserts. This is probably one of the few best meals we had in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

WQ_CNY9PN_bNDhrYeZu71A.text: Nice place to get cocktails! Romantic, dimly lit and mysterious. Really loved this vibe. Tucked away in Edinburgh's hills and it has a great bar scene. Nice cocktail list! The only disappointment was that after the waiter gave us the bar menu and when we were ready to order, he came over only to tell us that the kitchen was closed. Wee bit annoying. Wish they didn't give us menu at all if they weren't going to serve us. Still, a great place to come for a drink.

J0iHWjDN5--5f2CXp_NM4g.text: I will remember this restaurant forever! Tucked down a steep alleyway off the Royal Mile, Devil's Advocate has that hole in the wall mystery feel immediately. They have the widest selection of alcohol I have ever seen, and they have some great mixed drinks.  Definitely a good place to go if you want to experiment. The food is solid, but it is now where near as amazing as their drink selection! One of my favorite restaurants I've been to in the UK!

VD9AGab2ACm6PIGz1eIeUg.text: Devil's Advocate "should" be a great little spot for dinner to to dine in with a date. It has great 'tucked away to be found only by the locals' ambience and great beer (I recommend the Dia des los murtes IPA), but the food isn't 5-star and staff are quite capable of making mistakes. The upstairs eating area, although nice, means that staff spend a lot of time not seeing that you need them - particularly given that we gave me the wrong beer originally and I spent several minutes waiting to get it replaced (which they did with no fuss).  Probably the main thing that dragged my experience down though, was the hard sell I got from the guy giving me the bill, given both the less-than-fantastic service I'd received and the fact he'd not himself served me at any point before that exchange! Left with a 2-star taste in my mouth instead of a 3-star.  I'd probably grab a beer here with a couple of friends, and might edit this back up to a 3-star based on that experience, but I don't see myself eating here again when there's at least four better restaurants up the top of Advocate's Close and straight down George IV Bridge a couple minutes, let alone every other direction.

kZANW8g-k7hLRgPzwlh-rA.text: The staff are polite, warm and welcoming. The food is on the pricier side, but mouth watering. Music is a little louder than expected, but perfect for a dinner with a friend

UJNqNypD3WPzjonERv3hUg.text: I love The Devil's Advocate - it's tucked in the Advocate's  close in Old Town, and unless you accidentally stumble upon it or know about it, it may remain a hidden gem..  I was there recently for a pre-dinner drink with my husband. The place is not very big - it has a few seats downstairs and a mezzanine area reserved for diners. But it has a cosy atmosphere, great for candle lit chats.   If you want whisky, this is a great place for it as they have over 200 whiskies to choose from. However, we ordered a glass of pinot noir and a gin & tonic (table service). The drinks arrived and I requested a new glass as it looked dirty. They were very apologetic about it and actually deducted the wine from the bill, which was unnecessary but I accepted that.  I would love to try out the food as well so maybe next time it will dinner and drinks!

RCAFORrzusy96pIKb_pD6Q.text: Client took me here for dinner. Nice dark ambience with a large selection of wine and spirits. Many versions of scotch were ordered. I had the fish of the day. Very tender and tasty, portion was a bit small.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish of the day

f4X5YAm1rgHj6ZE2sVepmg.text: After a long morning of site seeing, we chose to visit the Devil's Advocate for a late lunch based on its proximity to our hotel, and its reviews.  Wow!  This was maybe the best meal that we had in Scotland with an interesting menu.    The drinks are creative and tasty.  My friend wanted to mix up the fun brand in one of her cocktails for our second round, and they kindly obliged her request, and then returned to check that it was still okay.   I LOVED my sweet potato chili (though my friend found it slightly too spicy) and my specialty salad.  All the ingredients were fresh and created in the perfect flavor combinations.  So delicious!  And our service was fantastic.    I would happily return for another meal!

FRz0ZXY2EmUgj2hdnUzJ1Q.text: A tiny haunt tucked into a nondescript alleyway that serves a mean old fashioned? Hell, they had me at the entire shelf of Japanese whisky, the rest was just icing on the cake.  After a colourful (read: boozy) start to our evening, myself and visiting Edmonton CM turned to the ol' Yelp mobile to continue our shenanigans with a few cocktails. Even with a map in front of us, it took three walk bys before we spotted the wee little alley that leads to this wee little cocktail bar. The stairs down (or up, depending on your vantage point) are perhaps the city's best sobriety test. I'm sure the door gents just watch and only allow those who can make it down without looking like they'll pitch to their certain death at any moment. Because of this, I very vocally pointed out the difficulty level of high heels on uneven steps as we teetered down in the rain.  With a quick shake of the umbrella, we stepped into a beautiful gem of a bar. I can't speak for the food, or the seating in general. To be honest - we saw the bar, and happily stayed put for a few rounds, but for that, I can happily speak to the quality of the libations.  It's a long standing tradition that I judge a bar by the oomph of their old fashioned. The Devils Advocate did not disappoint - they served up a beautifully balanced drink, made with care but without the 15 minute show you can get at other "we do good cocktail" joints. It was well made, without the pomp and much appreciated by our little party. But where this spot truly won my heart, was with a brief glance up to an entire shelf dedicated to Japanese spirits. A nice Yamazaki or Nikka is my newest whisky obsession and hailing from Vancouver, where you're lucky to see one or two bottles on the go, the sheer promise of a 5+ range? This lady is a happy camper.  Service was lovely, quick and no bs. The folks milling about the bar are a fun mix of eclectic professionals and the vibe is one that makes you want to pull up a chair and put back a few. I didn't get a chance to ask about their wifi, but seeing as though they open at 9am, I daresay with a good signal, this will fast become a regular "office" soon enough.  Either way, come cocktail hour, I will definitely be back. Afterall, I only tried two whiskies while I was there - more research is definitely needed. Worth getting lost for, and as always, mind the stairs.

e7slEsHQa09hKXxBKkA46w.text: I have been to many well-known bars around the world, and The Devil's Advocate is one of the best I have ever visited. Located in Advocate's Close, nothing about this bar program is less than superb. The cocktails, the alcohol selection, the staff, the environment, the ice; all amazing. It combines the best elements of many different bars in the SF Bay Area and eliminates the worst.   Caveats: I visited on a Wednesday night, and had Kyle as my bartender. Your Mileage May Vary.

PjuQPjxKFMpBvqubYJoOzA.text: This place is a hidden gem. The cocktails are delicious and their beer selection is very good too. The wine selection has a wine from pretty much every wine producing country in the world. Food is fuss-free and very tasty.  The staff are very attentive and efficient. Would definitely recommend.

9b81R57KImzkLI1QBP680A.text: Hot spot in Scotland.. We came on a Tuesday at 6pm and they told us next available is at 9:30pm, you must make a reservation ... We hung around the bar and grabbed a spot and were able to order dinner.. Food was good, nice ambiance and music.. Was very busy for a Tuesday night.

uOd7Z1LY-bKYszqXG0Uf1A.text: I love this place. The staff are so friendly and they let us stand (or sit) at the bar all night on busy Friday evenings. The cocktails are super tasty and it has an overall really friendly atmosphere.  I really have nothing negative to say - maybe the ladies toilets were a bit on the freezing side! haha  The night we were in they had some bartenders visiting from Poland or Norway (sorry I am predictably fuzzy on the details of the night) who allowed us to sample (for free!) some of their cocktail creations.  All in all, excellent tucked away venue, great friendly and knowledgeable service and a delightful atmosphere. Can't wait until I visit again!

8UpKQ6fdUyQNvMC7-jSPqw.text: Just simply fantastic.  I had the lamb at the suggestion of the host.  It was superb, balanced with a refined mixed salad that complimented the lamb at so many levels!  I ordered an outstanding IPA, also at the recommendation of the bar staff....it was great!  Service was a pleasing balance of relaxed but very professional with no pressure ....   What can I say, this was an evening to remember!!!!

8BG4dN2qBe5XiGUdPTkmBg.text: I'll be keeping four stars for now but had a pretty off putting experience here recently.  A few weeks ago, The Man and I popped in for a last drink before home (about 10:30 or 11). We went up to the bar to order, but were quickly whisked to a table instead. This was fine, except that no one told the wait staff that there was a new table waiting to be served and we sat there for about 10 minutes until we were able to flag someone down.  Drinks order placed, drinks received, all in order.    Until our drinks were finished.  We sat with empty glasses for long enough that "let's have one more" turned into "let's just go"  When we were finally able to get the bill, we quickly handed over our money, the bill whisked away, and no change given.   I get that tipping for table service is becoming more of a done thing, especially when getting special drinks like cocktails.  But certainly not for beers, and not when I tried to order at the bar anyway.    With the waitress well and truly disappeared, we had to go to the bar where we were faced with confusion about where the waitress had gone and hadn't we paid "AGES ago" anyway?  Yes we had, we've been waiting for change.   It all left us with a bad taste in our mouths.   I would go back, but for goodness sake just relax and let people order at the bar and we'll be alright.

Aa6cz_0is7u8WFvmEKkdjw.text: Definitely need more research before step in this amazing store. Too much whiskey to taste and OMG wonderful lamb burger&duck leg.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

iVxsUSVLAxB-yOeu7_FTUQ.text: I called here on a recommendation and it was awesome. We all had starters and a main and they were just perfect. The menu was quite limited (dinner menu) but we each found something that we liked and then loved once it arrived. The cocktail / drinks selection is also superior. Great service, food and it has a gorgeous rustic design inside. Love it. My starter was 4 and main was 13 which was spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish with hand cut chips

SF7Lr8PVqP3g6o4bc6INag.text: Coming from a Southern California girl, this place is pretty hipster. However, the staff were very friendly and it was in a great location. Food was slightly above average.

JeH0PTmNXp2eJEn3H1oLaw.text: WOW! Husband and I were completely blown away by the food here. By far the best food during our visit. The space itself is an amazing redo of an older structure, and the service was wonderful too. Highly, highly recommend!

kDLS_hYmC7LmTYUSdV3NOA.text: Great spot, loved the decor! We sampled a Carver (Bread, Meat, Cheese, Olives & Olive Oil) (Good) and I had the Ribeye (Great and tender) with Shoestring Chips, and my wife had the Chicken (Good). Tasty food in a great, just off the beaten trail, spot!

QJEy27SV97DF_Bm0Pmyarg.text: A real hidden gem - who knew it was possible to get so lost only a stone's throw from the Castle?!   This bar is tucked away on Advocate's Close up some winding steps that made me start thinking my colleagues had given me the wrong address. It has atmosphere by the bucketload, that builds from when you're wandering up the historic old Close, to when you're standing at the beautiful high-ceilinged bar with its rough stone walls that makes you feel like it's been carved into the hillside.  The clipboardful of drinks menus is a treat - several pages of whiskies that I must go back for, and cocktails that intrigue. Our bearded barman took real care over making these, and was a joy to watch and chat to.  My first cocktail was gin-based and enjoyable but it was the second that blew me away - if you're a whisky fan (and don't mind a girly glass) get The Convent. I always try to pick something with a new ingredient for me, and this had creme d'violet, malic acid solution, peat and heather, which all sounded suitably exotic! Oh and Highland Park 12. It was deliciously strong, and felt extra special after they told me it was the last one of the night because they'd run out of the violet stuff. Win!  Front of house staff are also on the ball - most of the tables were busy when we arrived but the lady who first welcomed us kept us in mind when one of these cleared, and explained we could sit until the reservation arrived. So we took a seat up on the mezzanine, at which point the guys promptly got food envy and ordered a couple of ham and cheese platters with bread and oil. Yum.  You probably need to book ahead for food, but it's a new fave to pop in for post-work drinks. Make sure you're not in a rush though, as you'll need time to pull yourself together and choose a drink after admiring the candlelit bar itself... :)

pTM7OCnE8tE4d18fO8vslQ.text: Friendly staff, killer selection of beers and cocktails, and the haggis bon bons are amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

u9V5HxaDoqJVedDlVtqe9A.text: Not surprised. Food is way average, not even close to be great in any way. Great selection of local draft beers and cocktails. Then again, I only recommend this place to get drinks because food is pricey, definitely not worth your money.

gsvGgmbJ5OetPckyR0WY6g.text: THE GOOD: Neat atmosphere and attentive staff.  Abundant whisky options and several different whisky flights poured high.  Pork chops and Beef Tails were cooked perfectly and presented elegantly. Moist meat and appropriate volume of sauce for flavoring. Many restaurants drown their meal is sauce to cover underlying flaws, no need here as the meat is well selected and prepared.  Decent selection and variety of deserts. The lemon desert provided a light zest on the palate with a creamy texture.  THE BAD: Nothing of mention.  THE UGLY: Nothing of mention.  OVERALL IMPRESSION: If you are in search of a centrally located, appropriately priced restaurant with perfectly prepared dishes and good atmosphere then look no further. I would highly recommend attending. They have a sister restaurant in the "new town" of Edinburgh called El Cartel which is also fantastic (see review).

Vdz72KipBfPZDwFyixRd8g.text: located in the advocate close, great view. A long list of beer and wine choices. Really a great place to gather with friends. :D

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. This restaurant &#39;s location is amazing! Very enjoy this duck leg,high recommended!!!!

FozCQGgyXpPgtqWK7kodZQ.text: Seriously, this place is an alcoholic's fairytale come True. SO much Whisky......SO much Gin....SO much alcoholic goodness all under one roof.  Such a great location in Edinburgh with an AMAZING view of the city as you descend Advocate Close. The bartenders are amazing. They are True chemists/artists as they concoct your drinks, whether it's something off the menu or something tailored to your specific taste. The place is high-energy and hopping and you'll find yourself amongst a crowd of discerning drinkers...naturally I felt right at home. The prices are very reasonable as well, and I can honestly I paid less here and for a MUCH more creative and tasty drink than at swanky high-end bars in Manhattan.  Go Edinburgh!   And go, Devil's Advocate!

q59NnB7nj5T4gda3XVZ0Dg.text: Restaurant is located in a neat location in the old town of Edinburgh. The building has great character.  The menu is very short but also has the feel of being very fresh.  We had an out of town guest with us, so the Scottish influence on the menu was a great option for him to try lots of local flavours.    Unfortunately we went on a night the owner was hosting a very large dinner adjacent to our table and things got very loud.  Perhaps reasonably so, the staff were more focused on the other dinner than ours.  It led us to feel both ignored then rushed at the same time.   Overall the food was nice, but the atmosphere left us unimpressed.

HRb_OOPrg88FfL4AUYyf7A.text: The brilliant alley to get away from the noise of the city center!! Especially the small balcony makes you feel like you are on vacation somewhere different. However, the place inside is also amazing.  Unfortunately, it is quite expensive..   Furthermore, we had the desserts, which were mousses (one lemon and the other caramelized chocolate) .. aaaand I am not a fan! I would like to have more options...  The four stars go to the environment which was very beautiful and comfortable!

1aExPVrXTNZwR41rRWhSCQ.text: Great ambiance and food. The menu is small but there are interesting options. The best part was the cozy atmosphere. Make sure to make reservations !! Very busy on a Saturday night. Would go again.

_O11OLczAjK0tTp7mwbiBQ.text: Absolutely my favorite place to eat!! I don't think I've ever had anything better. Awesome! I had the chicken and my bf had the pork chop... yum! And the truffle hollandaise fries were fantastic! Must go! I'll come back to Scotland just for this restaurant.

LkMjCGwBbh3W653WeO80OQ.text: Excellent cuisine, excellent ambiance we dined in cozy alcove booth.  Server had great recommendations.  We absolutely loved this spot for a great meal just off the Royal Mile.  Highly recommended to anyone who enjoys good cuisine.

j_J6FNXu1dEvqxvBgoJUGg.text: Joined these guys for Lunch twice. Was perfect for us. Reasonably priced meal, stellar drinks, smokin ambience, and killer tunes. Only regret wasn't giving dinner a shot, but we didn't think we'd get in.

dsjHpGjUK53ipPl9FNPEmg.text: I've been to devil's advocate twice now. The first time was part of an impromptu pub crawl, and I thought it was a pretty cool spot. Since then I've been keen to head back here and try out the food.   I had the pea and leek arancini, and my date had the butternut squash salad. I though the salad was pretty tasty, even if I'm not the hugest fan of cold salads when I'm super hungry. The arancini was absolutely scrumptious! A lovely crispy outside, with soft gooey risotto in the middle. Heaven. And definitely what I needed for my second (!!) dinner after yoga with a certain former CM.  My only down point for this place is the very limited desert menu. In fairness, DA is a Gastrobar thing and not an actual restaurant. The kitchen space is probably pretty limited for making a load of deserts.  All in all I really like this bar. I definitely want to try out more of their food, and more of what's behind the bar.

p-rrDZqJL5MzxT_cNtqUvg.text: Great experience! thanks for such a warm welcome. The choice of whisky and the advice are wonderful.

i2foQWotagLSd53QnWLhtw.text: The walk down the crooked narrow street to this wee hideaway bar just as the sun was leaving us for the day was really special and part of the dazzlement of devil's advocate.  This bar is amazing, quirky and has a really chilled vibe. The bar staff are knowledgeable about their alcohol and happy to whip up your favourite cocktail or invent one for you on the spot. Table service is available or you can stand in the bar area admiring the many bottles of whiskey on show or the bartenders ever growing beards and moustache art! It's such a cool bar and a great place to come with friends or visitors of the city. Reasonable prices for the quality of drinks, service and ambience, easily my favourite bar in Edinburgh and tonight you were looking beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Saturday fizzes!
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pick your liquor!

MdLmJHL4rjD2RO1v1Hl5gA.text: A very neat place. Good vibe good people good food.  A bit small on the portion size, but that's it. I would return if I am back in town!

seq0FQyOU9BJh3kaZI69PQ.text: A great vibe here - I love it. I'm annoying when it comes to cocktails but I do it on purpose ;) I love to ask for something that's not on the menu and like to be vague to see how good the guys are behind the bar...these guys are good and not at all prescriptive. Owned by the same chaps as Bon Vivant on Thistle Street. I didn't have the food here nor did we get the chance to sit at a table (you'll have to book) so we stood at the bar which is what my review is based on. The lighting is low and this place is excellent for a date night. Prices are Edinburgh average - not cheap but not ridiculously expensive either (cocktail ~8). A place I will be taking newbies to the city to.  When you turn off the Royal mile onto Advocate close just keep going and it's on your left hand side (there was a point when I thought we weren't on the right close!).

PjSFovRdVUcEub5iJNHU4Q.text: Great option for lunch while seeing the sights around the Royal Mile. While it was full of tourists (like us) did not feel "touristy." Nice ambiance, good food, good service.

VzuvgWWHuwWjuFnBUi_gGA.text: What an amazing Gastro Pub! I enjoyed a glass of sparkling vouvray with my North African Harissa spiced chicken. They have a wonderful cocktail menu which is unique and varied. A wide selection of scotches and whiskies. Their menu was very fresh and original. Truly a wonderful experience. You must try it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sparkling Vouvray! Can&#39;t beat it.
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. North African Spiced chicken with Harissa and couscous. Yogurt sauce with pomegranate and pumpkin seeds. Amazing!
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mixologist.

JASfWkITEsCEieBmJxdMKg.text: "We should check out that new place down Advocate's Close!" we said. Little did we know that it was a new regular haunt in the making. Great food and a massive list of whisky (and whiskey) coupled with no-BS serving! Shame about the beer selection, though.  Aside from the odd G&T and White Russian, I'm no big fan of cocktails. When I'm at home, I tend to prefer a straight up single malt if I'm not having beer or wine. When I'm out, I find spirits are almost always way too expensive. So! When I'm out, it tends to be wine with the food or beer at the bar. And the beer selection is a bit on the sad side when compared to the massive list of whisky and the general quality of everything else at Devil's Advocate.  So, that's the "bad" stuff out of the way (not so bad, really, just a matter of choice.) Let's move on to the good stuff!  I fairly regularly get visitors from out of the country, and when I do, I have a small selection of places I tend to recommend for food. Devil's Advocate has now joined First Coast (great and diverse food, decent prices), World's End (reasonable, proto-scottish pub-grub), Grain Store and Blackfriar's (Both high end, for when my parents visit and insist on paying).  I almost always order at least the black haggis bonbons to start with as they are a great and easily shareable haggis/ black pudding treat for people who are curious about haggis but not quite comfortable getting the full haggis, neeps and tatties experience. I really should start considering other options for myself, as the other starters look delicious!  Their burgers, though not the BEST I've ever had, are fabulous! Chunky and full of flavour and come with similarly chunky chips. You might need a fork, not necessarily for eating the burger (though it is one of those "take the top off to eat it" jobs) but for protecting your chips from the thieving fingers of your cohorts. You have been warned.  They change up their menu every now and then, and usually have a Fish of the Day, which is always worth considering. Their vegetarian options are limited but just as worthy of consideration as all the other meals. Last time I went, both my partners in crime opted for the butternut squash risotto after considering that and the oxtail, and it was great! For the record, I've tried their oxtail, and it's QUITE good.  It's been a while since I've had their desserts, I'll make a note to try them next time I go.  The service isn't full of unnecessary pleasantries, nor are they overly polite, but they're (usually) friendly and always effective and have always treated me and mine well. They know what they're doing and they do it well. That isn't to say they're terse or in any way unhelpful, just that I never felt like they were imposing a manufactured "friendly" atmosphere on us, as can happen in a lot of places.  All in all, a great place to go for food and cocktails, just not one I would stay in afterward to drink. And that's fine. They can't be everything to everyone.

19dyvwP5hZ-etenovEFG3w.text: Great meal - walked a mile in the rain so we were hoping this place would live up to the great reviews - and it did.  Had the fish and chips and a steak - both were very good.  Had wine, whisky and beer - it was medicinal. Service was good.

durJPy-b9SSsss1qmr1vOQ.text: Mad expensive, but a very very delicious burger that comes with fries. You'll be full, but your wallet will hurt.

LYPp7msc5kOjMHV6uMvLmg.text: Wow... This place was amazing. I first tried to get in without a reservation on Saturday night about 830... No chance. The bar was completely packed. It looked like fun, but I was solo and I didn't feel like fighting my way to the bar (plus the fact I was starving!)) I went back a couple days later for lunch with my team that was in town and we were all blown away. The attention to detail and the food is awesome. On a warmer day, you can sit outside... The whole experience is great. Highly recommend. Make a reservation!!

W51vbmSNe5vkLt-Gg-V5Rg.text: This place gets a great review for so many reasons..  1.  Service was awesome!  They got us in despite not having a reservation.   The bartender was really helpful, the waitress was so friendly 2. The ambiance is rocking!   They really kept an authentic feel to this place.   They have everything covered from the quieter table, bar, louder room and outdoor patios.  All are great.  And the walkway you take to get there is so amazing 3.  The food was top notch, they really worked hard to create a great menu and I saw our menu was different than what I saw on yelp prior, so they seem to change it seasonally.    We got a shared appetizer and I got the Venison, it was cooked perfect.  My brother got the pork chop, again cooked perfect!    Top stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Venison
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Current Menu
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

TTr_HWh6HF8wgBqCVUlqug.text: The bar is really cool. They have a massive selection of liquor and can mix just about anything. The bar itself looks awesome and unique. They have several nice beers on tap. When we came in it was already packed with people but the door man let us in for a beverage not the restaurant. The bar area was full with people waiting for the restaurant. Only a short walk from the Royal Mile. If you're debating which bar to visit, I would add this to your list!

fK6VBC0e9gDi_2dslNSWoA.text: Awesome venue, novel and concise gastropub menu including interesting cocktails and craft beer, stellar service, sizeable food portions. It's upscale enough to make for a romantic date night.  The Devil's Advocate is a modern looking buildout in a historic part of Edinburgh. Inside the venue, they've done an excellent job incorporating the original, now exposed, stonework with modern decors like Edison lights and exposed ceilings. There is an upper loft of table seating along with an open floor space near the bar. We sat up in the loft for dinner service. Interior lighting was very dim, which gives it an old tavern-like ambiance.  The menu here is rotating and concise with limited options, which is a good thing. I went for some local beer on draft that tasted fresh and was served in a large mug to keep the tavern feel going. Wife went with a signature cocktail, which tasted great and was served in a chilled, stainless shaker. Wife ordered the whole grilled sea bream, which I tried and it was phenomenal. Bone-in, rock salted, crispy skin. Wow! I ordered the braised lamb shank, which needed some salt but was otherwise braised to perfection served with a unique carb base of al dente chickpeas. Service was phenomenal throughout the evening.    Overall, this was one of our favorite dining experiences in the UK.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Braised Lamb shank with chickpea base
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Grilled whole seabream. Unreal flavor

qmJd3diGVeMcO7uL2cvysg.text: Ambiance was outstanding. Seating was very close. Tried to go one night without a reservation, and couldn't get in, so we made a reservation the next night (Hint: Make reservations at night) I heard about the burgers being great, but they must be a daytime item, as there were no burgers on the menu when we went. All of our food was great however, even if i didn't get a burger. Whiskey lovers will enjoy the place, as many many selections. We had grown fond of Ciders here in the UK, and their only cider options were in a can. That's the only down side. Give it a try, and you'll enjoy the meal!

q3rwje9ZnkfFXkeYz3PGuQ.text: Great spot in Edinburgh! Bar is super busy and fun. Cozy eating atmosphere upsatirs with great service from the staff. I had the Jacob's Ladder (Short Ribs) and it was a huge rib, falling off the bone with tons of delicious tender beef. Cool cocktail and good wine list.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

w-RAi7KXtYlCA59s-bg34Q.text: Good cocktail spot, wasn't busy early in the evening. Got the Doha date which was pretty good and def recommend. Didn't get food.

LdWW31y3traSGIkL1RYJEA.text: Off the beaten path by the Royal Mile. Great spot to have everything Scotland. We had a flight of scotch as well as the haggis to start. It was excellent! The restaurant is extremely small so make sure you make a reservation. There is seating outside,however, very cold due to it being in a close.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

rudJ9TbUdOh6XUfXPCQLjw.text: This place was sooo good!  The drinks were amazing (and we are pretty hard to please) and the mint & pea soup was INSANE - even my kids and husband loved it and they don't like pea soup. I would seriously consider flying all the way back to Edinburgh just to have this soup again - that good! We also got steaks, chicken and cod. All of which we loved. We all agreed that this was our favorite meal of the trip.

sAx6fW6nrFGD1cjoLKecpQ.text: Hidden gem of a mixology pub; down the narrow Advocate's close, in an ancient stone building.   The scotch, bourbon, and whiskey selection is outstanding, and it allowed me to savor the 21-year old Glennfiddich Gran Reserve.  I love a good single-malt scotch, and always have Glenfiddich at home - but don't often get the chance to enjoy the 21 year old variant!  The mixed drink menu is also great; I suggest the Black Dog, and the Rest on Your Laurels. Well done!  The food here is supposed to be excellent as well, but we ended up leaving before our table was open.  If you do stay to eat, there are good outdoor areas beside the close, as well as private booths snd an upstairs area.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The 21-year old Glennfiddich Gran Reserve!  Smooooth.
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Black Dog; try this - you&#39;ll like it!
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Devil&#39;s Advocate bar is well stocked!

VpWtNomTauE-m9FiV8xxLw.text: One of the coolest bars ever. Built into the steep side of one of Edinburgh "closes" - narrow slip roads that wend their way through the streets, carrying you from one gothic level to another - the mood here is trendy medieval, if there is such a thing. The bar space is massive and the main dining area is upstairs. When we popped in, we didn't have a reservation, but they told us that we could eat if they could have the table back in an hour. We had a ghost tour in 90 minutes, so this was more than ideal! Despite the time constraints, we didn't feel rushed. The menu is solidly British. Highly recommend any of the fish dishes. The beer selection is lovely as well. Overall, an awesome experience in a very cool setting. Don't miss this place when you're in Edinburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beautiful dining
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cod - excellent
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Awesome bar!!!

Gj3r2ctBPqXbwWDmWTApng.text: Quite possibly the most hipster place I visited while abroad. We arrived for a late lunch around 2:30 on a Saturday. There was no one to greet us and it seemed pretty chaotic. Bartenders trying to make drinks, food runners racing up and down the stairs, and no host stand in sight. We finally waved down a worker, told him our party size, and he said it would be a 20 minute wait... didn't take our names or anything so we just stood at the bar and ordered drinks. The drink menu is vast and there are a number of creative cocktails available. Our wait ended up being closer to 45 minutes, but whatever.   The upstairs area is pretty small, so I wasn't surprised why we waited to so long to be seated. The service was pretty nonchalant-- no sense of urgency, greeting, or description of the menu. Luckily, we still had our drinks that we ordered from the bar and were able to place our food order right away. Our food took awhile to come out. However, the falafel/lentil appetizer was very unique and tasty. The fish and chips were okay, not the best I had while traveling. My husband's burger was very dry and definitely needed some sauce or cheese to moisten it up. It did have a "tomato salsa" on it that resembled neither tomato nor salsa, but more of a tomato paste. It was weird in a bad way. He was pretty disappointed with how terrible the burger was, considering so many other reviewers raved about the burgers here.   Overall, we had an A-OK time. Would I come back? Maybe for a cocktail. Was it the best hipster place I experience while abroad? No.
