Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Falafel lentil starter
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Curiosity Killed the Captain

aNMQquXYuKpFkvSLpmESoA.text: This restaurant has a fun vibe with great music and even better food! Mark set us up with a new cocktail to discover. The pork chop dish was so good and a perfect balance of flavours! The truffle parmesan fries were amazing and we ordered a 2nd one! They were super flexible to split or 1/2 an order for our kids too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

_7qBeAr0P359-adMltFi_g.text: Cute little bar and restaurant that was near our hotel. The food was absolutely fantastic! I took off one star because, for the price, we left a tad hungry. I ordered the baked cod in a leek and artichoke sauce. It was so yummy, but definitely needed a side or bread. My husband ordered the lamb, which was a bit more substantial. For dessert we ordered the chocolate mousse. It had orange and almonds in the ingredients, and was something to write home about! And our service was really excellent. It was a Monday so we got in and a table was emptying, but I would suggest reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chocolate mousse
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Baked cod

iRfOofdqMErsJ-nSaegyrQ.text: We had the smoked fish board, the parmesan and truffle chips and the lamb. This place had Awesome ambiance, great wait staff, very friendly. The food was later with flavor, and I just really over being here. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

F3dd3edC6jxeO3OZsBsxiQ.text: Delicious food in a great space down one of Edinburghs charming closes. We had both vegeterian and gluten free options and all items were delicious! I would highly recommend making a reservation before you go.

9mb2pXwDwWhv_1fA54zWog.text: Excellent restaurant with quality food and drinks!  I love that they had a short menu, nothing makes me cringe when they give me a book of options unless if it's the drink menu. They had very unique cocktails you can chose from and the food was very tasty. I got the orzo salad along with the tomato soup and a side of bread.

0bjY_xXUBGrlqRznzQ8xeA.text: Hidden on Advocate's Close down the stairs off the Royal Mile. Stopped in for drinks on a cold afternoon after museums. Opted for a hot toddy and a drink called the "Arcadian Man." Both we're fantastic Marker's Mark and Bullet bourbon based cocktails. We also order a couple standard Old Fashioned's which were equally good. Not much space in the bar area but definitely worth sticking around even if a table isn't readily available. Decor is great. Quick attention from the server as well. Happy we stopped by!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Good, The Bad, and The Toddy &amp; The Arcadian Man

U-4g-xPyBZffhmUSxBLe0w.text: My family and I recently traveled to Edinburgh and had dinner at The Devil's Advocate. The wine and cocktails were excellent, as was the lamb. The peas, onions and white sauce adorning the dish were fantastic! One of the best dishes we had in Scotland. Only negatives were that the restaurant was VERY loud and we had trouble hearing each other. Also, there's a dumbbell that brings up food from the kitchens to the second floor, and our waiter left halfway through taking our orders to take a dish to another table. I'd highly recommend if you like great food and drinks, and don't mind a loud atmosphere and sightly inattentive staff.

N5dUJ2nmdVdKJodYxV4RuQ.text: The food was great great customer service and the vibe in there is really hipster. Also great price!

lI8g2ax-b62q06ucs39SyA.text: This place is great to have dinner and drink. We had Corn fed chicken and Roaster Heritage beetroot. They were amazing and very delicious. They have great cocktails. The place is a bit crowded and noisy, however great atmosphere. Definitely recommend this place.

mxmCDjKXv_xZ8fxUED_6LQ.text: No food this time.  I was waiting at the bar and I saw the 'cocktail master' preparing some delicate cocktails. I asked him to provide me with a signature spicy Bloody Mary. He was happy to oblige. I found that he was using a 'celery bitter' and this has now become a real hit with me. I could easily identify the bitter and found it very pleasing.  Service overall has been efficient and welcoming.  I may return for a meal at some point.

75V73-c5XrpP-PQVA3daiA.text: Dropped over here with some random people I met during my first week of school. It has a far more intimate atmosphere than we expected inside, but there is an outdoor seating area for people who just want to grab a few drinks. It's nothing special though, just a few tables and seats. I loved the atmosphere inside even though I was not there for a date. Furthermore, the drink menu had some very interesting items! We just had a few beers, but the cocktails seemed fantastic. I'll definitely drop back to see what this place truly has to offer.

DEal6izd4V-6pHYA-OKnPg.text: Incredible whiskey, wonderful staff, exactly the Scottish experience I've been waiting for. The ambience is awesome, too, and because the entrance is tucked away from the main streets it's not overrun with tourists. Highly recommend!

814Dm11PxdRHj7jZsULDCw.text: Classy place, I recommend it for the atmosphere. The cocktails, however, don't quite work. Either you have to really enjoy whiskey, or something about how they choose to pair it (trying to be inventive but seems to not quite work)- just not my cup of tea. The bar itself has the feel of a NYC loft and nestled in old town on a street most tourists wouldn't think to walk down, I love taking people there to be surprised at what is in there.

2GqAyC06J8gg6KwJwgIcfA.text: Love the location. Very unique. And staff were very friendly.  However I'd say the dinner was marginal. Burger was dry and overdone. Chips and house salad both underseasoned. I'd love to give them another chance at dinner with a different main course.

L9wn_T1xqfld1_hPEGG5Nw.text: Great place, cosy bar with lovely restaurant upstairs.

1Fwt6CSjbmw3M3AkcJTqmA.text: Great service from knowledgable bar staff - very busy so would require a booking for dinner reservation. We unfortunately didn't get the chance to eat but enjoyed some drinks and the ambience.

PEg9Gcmi_NcoIB8kam4npQ.text: I'd heard about this place, both on here and on the TWITTAH grapevine. Given I was wandering aimlessly from place to place the other night, I figured this would be a test of my navigational skills.  I never realise where the stairs at the bottom of Advocate's close came on until I walked down them after I left here, but I'm getting ahead of myself now, I suppose. Back to the beginning!  So from the outside, it looks nice and new and stylish and clean, and a big glass door entrance. When you go in, it's very modern and funky, all exposed brick and chrome and black steel... indeed, the first thought I had was that I'd walked into the nightclub from the original Terminator movie, which would have been weird and required time travel too.  There was a huge range of spirits behind the bar, and the staff seemed to be spot on with their recommendations to people; I settled for a bourbon, lemonade, and lime - and it came in at a reasonable 4. For a modern-ish new bar, that's not bad, especially in city centre Edinburgh prices.  It was exceedingly busy when I was in, about 10pm on a Friday evening, and a lot of people did seem to want to be there to be seen to be there, if you know what I mean. Wandering in off the street on my own, I did feel a little out of place, and the lack of hidey holes or wall based drinking places stuck out like a sore thumb to me.  All of those problems wouldn't have mattered if I wasn't Johnny No Friends and was with a huge group, so that's on my head, not the bar's :)  With all that in mind, I would definitely come back here, although I think it would have to be early in the night to try and get a seat!

vw1FWm2SIL-o-C0HVMA3Vw.text: Has an amazing selection of whiskies, however was just a little on the quiet side when we went (Thursday 4pm) which made the atmosphere a little dull. Cute location and has a great interior!

HxQytdB1Dmfy0xKbqz7s_Q.text: Most magical place in Edinburgh to chill out post strolling around town. Fantastic service, unique ambience and super happy & knowledgable staff. We were there late in the afternoon so the place wasn't too busy. The bar is unique and beautiful. (This isn't a review for the bar) We sat upstairs near the exterior patio, had a nice view of the outside. Our waiter was super nice and helpful. He recommended the world's best cocktails. We had a few drinks-- my favorite was the one with vodka, strawberry shrub and prosecco --and all of them were perfectly crafted. We each ordered a salad, not the crappy house salad but the most scrumptious plate of greens greatness we've ever tasted ( rare roast beef, blushed sherry tomatoes, soft boiled egg, crispy onions, sherry & nigella, and shaved parmesan!) I'm drooling just thinking about it. Wish I had taken better photo of it if I had known it was going to be the best plate of salad...ever! My sidekick ordered the crispy black pudding and blue murder salad. We tried black pudding all over town including Ireland. The Stornoway product they used there was the best!! We shared a plate of their chicken marinated with North African spices. It has pomegranate, bulgar wheat, rose harissa, pumpkin seeds and top with mint yoghurt. While it was delicious, THE salad took front and center stage!! We chatted with our server for a long time about living in Edinburgh and places to eat, and he was extremely generous with his knowledge of the city and even look up the address of another restaurant for us to try. We love this place and look forward to returning on our next trip to Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. North African Spices Marinated Chicken
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zO6YnHYJnFG-8dv4qwIBhA.text: Great lunch. My friend won't stop talking about the pork belly and beef burger.  Excellent cocktails and service.

WePRhSZ95wg5mEEHkdsyGA.text: You'll find this restaurant down Advocates Lane which makes it nice as its away from the hustle and bustle particularly during festival time. Inside it has a very rustic feel with brick walls and candlelight. The bar area is the first area you see with a wall of whiskies. Upstairs you will find the restaurant with a balcony area for eating outside. Small selective menu with great vegetarian options. Food was fantastic and well presented. They have an unusual cocktail menu, none of the regular and more popular cocktails on the list however they can make you something if requested. I would definitely recommend trying one of the cocktails. Staff were knowledgable when asked several questions about the menu as we were there with friends from France they were able to answer any questions we had. Great knowledge about the whiskies as 1 of party asked for advice on what whisky to have based on what she liked and staff were able to recommend. I would definitely go again

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Inside restaurant upstairs, very cosy

0vQZgxBv-SYYMEEhM5b6vQ.text: An unexpected turn led us towards The Devils Advocate. I'm glad it did.  A great location and venue. The food was fantastic. Especially the Haggis bonbons that everyone has mentioned.  The staff were all very good. Quite attentive and helpful. Especially the super cute redhead waitress from Winnipeg of all places.  Go here, you won't be disappointed.

9XxLHDwRia1_elvBYBdLmw.text: A hidden gem in Edinburgh. Amazing wine and whiskey menu. Beautiful food and excellent service!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lovely!
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious!

KQn2p-iQj6BFKyGlRJCJwg.text: Nice place, came in for a beer but they do not have cider on tap, only bottles. The prices are jacked up for tourist. Really good location but be careful with the stairs and drinking, can be deadly. Besides that, luv the decor and the name , will return next time for more food and beer!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Plenty to drink!
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Great decor

666oSmfA4uluMMEwut0gFw.text: Frankly awful service, with pretentious and apathetic waitresses. I kindly asked for the menu twice but got only a cursory response and never even received the menu. There was no ordering at the bar either. For the prices they charge, you'd expect at least basic service and courtesy. Be warned.

HmZTnhHOfdefhXOOiU17WA.text: This place is a heavy 4 stars! Never ate the food here, always came for drinks, and the drinks are amazing! Definitely come here! Amazing wooden atmosphere, not too bright and super comfy feel. They make amazing whiskey cocktails!

0OZJDlOQ1q8YO7P6GykNWA.text: Lied about having no tables when they saw my teenagers and let the next group in with no reservation . Rude host as well.

B7qwr0lfYxjgn9t-Fe7LxA.text: Very reasonable prices with excellent services and foods. Venison and the duck salad are wonderful. Whisky sour must dry! We went twice!

yoiCqAKcPZss74QUoB7l5w.text: Fun upscale pub-style restaurant.  The tapas were great, and the ambiance was fun and upbeat.  I am not a scotch drinker, but for those that are, [others in my group are] they have a selection of scotch that cannot be beat.  Go for the fun, food and laughs!   You will be happy you did!

jblLIwF2VyTCCBm7eOVEOw.text: Came here with the hubs on the recommendation of a friend who had been here on a recent trip to Scotland. Took us a little bit to find it but it was worth the walk. The atmosphere is great, menu is small but excellent. I had the burger, which was excellent and cooked perfectly (even with my special request to cook the bacon crisp). Hubs had fried cod and chips, neither of which was heavy or greasy. The beer/wine/cider/spirits selection is excellent. Some outdoor seating. Indoor: Seating is limited and space is kind of tight, as is to be expected in these areas. As a mom of four, I'm thinking this isn't a great place to bring young kiddos. Highly recommend for couples. Casual dress code. Def will return when ever we return to Edinburgh!

NGtJZ0oe__e0S8jDgu0G4g.text: Outstanding cocktails, killer vibe. Hostess was a bit cold/snooty per prior reviews (this is Edinburgh not Manhattan..calm your arse down). Bartenders know their craft and will delight you with the well-crafted house cocktails or concoct one to your taste. The Mangoes Into A Bar (Bruichladdich whisky, mango syrup, Peychaud's) completely impressed me - simply revolutionary. Not sweet at all and perhaps the most well-balanced whiskey cocktail I've had ever. The Double Standard (Millstone rye, Zuidam Genever, raspberry, citric) was visually deceptive (raspberry-colored) but packed a punch. Both drinks were complex and well-made.  Couldn't be bothered with the food here as reviews heavily weigh on drinks, not fare, but headed straight to Whiski Bar per barstaff recommendation afterward.Highly recommend the drinks!

66yrw-euYJ6v-6bRGqLycQ.text: Wow! Excellent food, outstanding service, and such ambience. We loved everything about this place. Hard to find but worth the effort!

Cmu3cfA2zbyH-KYKZ-wkOQ.text: Was looking forward to dinner here as we had talked to a few people that recommended it however I was highly disappointed. I am fairly certain had we been sat upstairs in the regular dining area our experience would have been different but we were sat downstairs right next to the bathrooms. It was busy so we just dealt with it but the service down there was an afterthought. It took an extremely long time between having anyone  help us and had to grab a different waitress to get our main course sent out, my steak was cooked ok on one half but the other was completely raw and was more like chewing gum not to mention Luke warm as it must have been sitting out for some time. I would have sent it back but again no waiter during the entire course of the meal.

Yv3z7nzOCqUcfrz-rcp6nw.text: Largest selection of scotches I've seen, but this is the first spot I've stopped. I don't drink scotch but the atmosphere here is great, warm and cozy. I had s lovely glass of wine and cheese platter. The plate was amazing and completed as my dinner. Dinner didn't start until 5 so there was a small menu available and as I understand the items on that menu are not available once the dinner menu starts. I would suggest maybe ordering off the small menu at 445 as appetizer then at 5 dinner... if that could work.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

v6qyctlyU3FEIfKLxUis5A.text: I rarely give 5 stars but this place rocks on all levels: food, drinks, ambiance,  AND service.  Coming fromChicago, I have high standards and DA is the real deal!    From the moment we walked in, the service was friendly and attentive.  The wine list hit all needs.  The food was really solid and the prices were insanely good.    All local foods!  We had the watermelon gazpacho, the Tweeds lamb special, pork chop, cheese plate and a smoked pineapple dessert.  We left comfortably full.  The charm. The casual cool elegance. The knowledgeable and friendly service.  5 stars.  Well done!!   Thank you for a wonderful memory.

j7JPHw3UfwHS19uiepbJFA.text: This restaurant was amazing. The people were incredibly friendly, and the food was delicious. The tables were nicely set and there was a wonderful warm atmosphere to the whole place. The only slight complaint I have is that I ordered the picanha "a little pink" and it came medium rare. I suppose that is my fault, however, for not specifying just how pink I liked it. When I asked for it to be cooked a bit more, everyone was extremely friendly and cooked it perfectly to my liking. It was excellent. Would definitely recommend this restaurant. By far one of the best in Edinburgh.

6rNW1zEHABpmO1bcMzHDdw.text: We had attempted to go somewhere else, but it was unfortunately closed. So we wandered aimlessly until we saw tourists photographing one of the many closes in Edinburgh.  The advocate close led us to a restaurant. At first we were slightly confused how to get in, but clearly you just keep going down the stairs and don't attempt the left turn.   They advertised a dinner menu at the door and we decided to lunch here. We were kind of expecting the prices for lunch to be a bit cheaper than the dinner menu. But perhaps that is the norm when dining in Edinburgh and with the proximity of the Royal Mile..  I ordered the Swordfish main that was 14, which I thought was reasonable. The waitress returned to say that there was a problem with the communication with the kitchen. They were all out of Swordfish! This only left about 4 mains options, apart from the grill options (steak etc). Nothing really appealed, but finally I opted for the Crispy Polenta main with poached egg, long stem broccoli and hollandaise sauce 14. My OH had the fish and chips 15.  I just want to say that we were both pleasantly surprised. The Crispy Polenta was a delicious dish. A bit like some sort of brunch dish, but I love brunch so this was ideal. The fish and chips were pretty awesome. The fish tasted really fresh and not that horrible oily-fatty way!  So glad we discovered this little wonder.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish and chips.
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Polenta, poached egg, long stem broccoli and hollandaise sauce.

DcaYo5nu7DqOWvqmwdmdww.text: Excellent food and especially amazing cocktails (maybe my top 1 cocktail) Go to share great meat and modern scottish food with friends  Book before and have a drink at the bar first!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Best cocktail

CnomrYR5LLeUIAN683xoAQ.text: Great food and amazing atmosphere. A little hard to find if you don't know your way around but totally worth it.

lL7aL5tc5Twoe8Ebipy70g.text: The food is really, really delicious. It's best to make a reservation because the tables are extremely limited. The menu is limited but the the selections are diverse and interesting. Vegetables are extremely fresh. Joe had grilled polenta with vegetables and poached egg. I had an extremely well prepared steak that was medium rare. Not medium and not rare. The place was very busy with lots of people coming to gather at the bar and at the bar tables around the outside of the restaurant. Seems very popular in the area. Cocktails are excellent, very inventive and tasty. Really fun place to hangout

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Walk down to Devils Advicate
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Grilled polenta and veggies

dHqpgYgXYoTY4au9t22YAA.text: This was our first night in Edinburgh and we were walking up and down the royal mile looking for a place to eat and drink and we wanted something not directly on the royal mile. So we ended up going to the devils advocate. First of all the walk down advocates close itself was really pretty, and then when we entered the devils advocate, we knew this is exactly what we were looking for. The staff were super helpful and friendly, they accommodated the 4 of us without reservation (don't forget to reserve a table here :)) because someone else canceled theirs.  Their scotch based cocktails were amazing. We tried almost all of them. Food menu is small but everything we ordered was fantastic. We will definitely come back here. Highly recommended, you will not be disappointed.  Ambience: 5/5 Drinks: 5/5 Food: 5/5

bGSofK5p6eFM0fgf0uyIjA.text: Having sampled over 10 restaurants, pubs, and bars during my stay in Edinburgh, this was my favorite!  Admittedly, we did not dine here, but I loved the ambiance and excellent whisky collection.  This is a place that has a much more hip, modern vibe than most of its neighbor pubs in the Old Town area.  The ambiance reminded me of a quintessential hip New York bar, but of course the scotch whisky selection is far better!  In fact, we liked it so much here that we came back for a second visit in the span of 3 days.  We shared some snack platters along with our drinks, and the food was delicious. I know a place is good when I love their olives, because I typically do not enjoy olives... the ones here, however, were to die for.  Their prosciutto was excellent as well.  I cannot speak to the dinner food, but I would not hesitate to try it the next time I'm in Edinburgh.  They serve beers on tap in either full or half pints, which is handy in case you're not in the mood to guzzle a full pint.  I had one cocktail while I was here, a whisky one, and it was amazing.

Y_lnWgaFVCZiml8E_FFSXA.text: I've been twice, intending dinner both times, but foolishly the first time failing to book in advance.   Apple maps actually functioned here for once, and led us straight to the little alley that I'm not surprised people miss, though I was slightly alarmed navigating the steep steps in early december, which unfortunately, are unavoidable. The tucked away alley is apparently always quiet, but the devil's advocate is always packed, dimly lit, cosy, small, and i'd even push to say ambience over atmosphere (micky flanagan jokes, and all that) you can mostly drink standing, there are a few tables you can sit at for bevies, but they're mostly for eating.   As a whisky drinker, she slurs, you've got a pretty damn good choice here, and not just scotch either. These guys now how to present a pretty bar but there are lists too so you don;t have to annoy every human tutting behind you who knows exactly what cocktail they want. The bar staff know their shizzle, they obviously know how to help tourists with no whisky experience under their belts at all. Again, be wary of the peaty ingredients if you aren't fan of smoke, expect florals and botanicals too, nice gin list as well, which if you ask me, is always worth noting. The platters are great sharers and assembled nicely, I was a big fan of the haggis bon bons, and my meat was cooked to perfection.  I do plan to visit again at some point, mostly because I flipping love edinburgh.

VworchNpmnyn-ks3L_v5ZA.text: Good place! I like the boards. Smoked mussels are tasty. I also enjoyed the dim light in the room (candle and no light bulb), but some people might not like it. Too crowded but service was fine. BTW my lovely lamb leather shoes were scratched when I was climbing up the stone stairs , so girls be careful lol

JLuwKIbOmhe8JOgLG4EnFg.text: Hidden away from the tourists is this wonderful pub with a warm atmosphere and a delightful staff. I had the fish and chips (crispy thin fries) and they were perfect. Starter salad with olives was the best I had in Scotland. Local whiskey paired with dessert was a memorable end to the meal. Excellent place to eat and drink.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Yes, it was delicious. BTW - you&#39;ll find in the UK that arugula is called &#39;rocket.&#39;

CbXP-5AtuTnONmG52-FIUQ.text: Five stars solely for the very kind Aussie bartender who helped me choose a single-malt whisky I really enjoyed based on my laughably unspecific preferences.  She took the time to explain the flavors and origins of each thing she pulled for me.  They have a HUGE selection here, and I was able to try something I'd never have ordered on my own.   Thank you bartender!  While the bar itself isn't touristy, it is mere steps away from the Royal Mile, so the clientele is an interesting mix of regulars and tourists.  I can't comment on the food, but I was there early (5:30ish on a Wednesday) and there were already people waiting for tables.

37lz6V7yK3_211o3aCyWYw.text: Went back to this spot this week- last time was in October. Food, drink, service & ambiance are spot on. It's chill but beautifully appointed. Food is tasty & so inventive. Great cocktail list and just a really nice staff. Highly recommend this spot for sure

5Hx3p44IPwTJTikl3S10LQ.text: We had fun locating this bar! Such a fun place and it has a great atmosphere. This is "a must" when you are in Edinburgh!

GladbYFvIKFG53GZJDQ6aQ.text: We couldn't walk past the Devil's Advocate simply because of the name. This place is a must if you are visiting Scotland as it feels like a traditional pub.  We went in for drinks - mainly to enjoy different types of Scottish Whiskey. We were not disappointed. The bartender was well informed and provided us each with several drinks we enjoyed thoroughly.  When we visited it was on the quieter side which made it a nice place to sit and have a drink and visit with friends. It's location is also very walkable from different public transportation sites and the downtown area.  We really enjoyed speaking with the staff. This is one of the best parts of the Devil's Advocate. The knowledgeable and friendly staff. We will definitely be back.

rbIgyHfOXKAnsfnKCpVuDQ.text: I ordered the crispy polenta with mushrooms, spinach, figs, and hazelnuts and it was so good. My husband ordered the ribeye with chips and he enjoyed his too. The star may have been the salted caramel chocolate mousse, we shared it and it was delicious. Great place.

BoHBmg02Lw3__cKAiGc6DA.text: Fantastic bar and restaurant. To be honest, the gin and tonic I ordered (with Harris gin) was better than the house specialty cocktail, so the mixology may or may not be your taste, but fear not--the bar is well-stocked! All the food was delicious, and the service is great.

UEBZAeC-tf-Ea5i3FVmVBA.text: Wonderful place, make reservations as they book up quickly. Mussels are epic, we had cod and tenderloin with delightful peppercorn sauce. Service was fun and outstanding. Great hidden spot like many cool places in this incredible city. If you can get a table just do it!

5BBjpM09kr9PQa6IhMm9dA.text: My wife and I dined here and had amazing food and drinks. Definitely make reservations. Our first drop in we learned they were booked so walk-ins are uncommon. The next day we called to make reservations for that evening. The bar is wonderful and the ambience of the restaurant is very nice.

PlituCIE2VtcvFj2dlee5Q.text: Our favorite restaurant in Edinburgh! We tried the house board, mussels and sirloin steak. All were EXCELLENT! The mixed drinks were top notch too. Service was attentive and super friendly. Highly recommend this place, it is wonderful!

hcIEgKVmpszfnqUUcDMK4g.text: Yes, we are that couple.  We brought our 1 year old to a bar. Luckily, these Scots were just lovely and were more than happy to entertain our idea. The food is delicious and fresh. The service is amazing. Get the haggis appetizer, is was amazing! Wonderful ambiance, loud and fun music.   Just do it!

hYbk0c3zkeb8JSzlOUAAAA.text: Nestled in the middle of an alley, the Devils Advocate is a hidden gem! It can be hard to find if you're not looking closely. The cocktails are fantastic. My favorite was Foragers Club. We were there around 4pm and sat downstairs. They were getting ready to start serving food upstairs at 5. Since it was too early for dinner food, we were able to order off of the "nibbles" menu. The Truffle Parmesan fries were AMAZING. I wish I could put that sauce on every food I eat from here on out. We had to leave before 5pm, but I hope to return to try the rest of their food!  P.s. our waitress told us that next time we come for food it might be best to pre-reserve a table as it can get busy!

oxNj7AjXtTPz4kcj6kDXaA.text: The Devil's Advocate lived up to its hype! The best chips (fries) I've ever had!!! I ordered the fish and chips and the cod was so good. The tarter sauce was also incredible! My girlfriend also got their burger which was phenomenal!! Last but not least... the scotch flight was so damn good!!! And the ambience was so cool inside!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scotch whisky flight
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

OrQM-_gboD-FZU_tztXSWQ.text: If a hipster bar and a speakeasy had a baby, this place might be it   I just had to come here for the number one rated spot in Edinburgh. I wasn't super hungry so I stopped in for an appetizer and some wine after a day tour. The place is hidden down an alley, which gives it unique character already.   I love the atmosphere and decor. I sat in a small booth off from the bar. The lighting is dark, the waiters are as hipster as they come and super friendly!  I ordered the soup, which was a courgette and fennel soup - it was divine!   I would definitely come back here next time I'm in town. Such a cool spot!

yfWjMX7ECA1LWrHgpxCbXg.text: Even though the service is dismissive, I had high hopes for the food. My starter cauliflower soup was delicious and I was impressed. The main was okay, it was well portioned, but the sauce was slightly bitter and it lacked depth. Truthfully, I probably make a roast that tastes better than their brisket. Dessert was the same. Not well balanced and just fell flat. Back to the service, it seemed like there was one woman who was warm and engaging. The rest made me feel like they were doing me a favor by being there.

ha8hk5YUrTNMQ5DJ6r8ogw.text: Great dining experience at devils advocate for the following reasons: 1. Everything we ordered was well conceived and well executed (house sampler, crispy polenta main, thai coconut fish)  2. Staff was friendly. 3. Ambiance was special and interesting. 4. A huge scotch list to choose from and some good IPAs on tap.

3eGRq64Gx98CXMJcFzYSIg.text: Holy moly! This place was out of this world. We came here upon recommendation from a friend, and I will certainly recommend for anyone visiting Edinburgh. We got the smoked fish platter plus two mains, drinks, and it was off the chain! The service was outstanding and the food was nothing but exceptional. Thank you!

n89BAP2WZAcR-B6kfQ4Olw.text: I had an awesome dinner here. Very cool location and bar area. I didn't have a reservation (rookie mistake) but luckily was traveling alone and was early so they were able to seat me. I had a spring pea risotto that was incredible - super creamy and fresh. The bartender recommended a beet root whiskey drink that was really interesting (in a good way).

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Spring pea risotto
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beet root whiskey drink - very good and different

AX5DvdDT-7gVvjpGUX4sNQ.text: Such an excellent (not so) hidden gem in Edinburgh!   Tucked away down Advocate's Close, this is such a great little nook - a place to enjoy the charms of the Old Town while hiding out from the crowds that come along with it.   I've eaten here a few times, most recently in mid-September. The menu was considerably more expensive than I'd seen it on previous visits: I'm not sure if this was a Festivals hangover or if they figured out they could charge more what they offer. It seemed like a bargain before, and a little over-priced this time at around 100 for two: that's with a shared starter, 2 mains, and a few cocktails.   The food is what I think of as high-end gastropub - with twists on some classics. This visit I had a potato soup take on haggis, neeps and tatties. For main, I went for the venison with winter berries, which was cooked perfectly but a little too sweet. I was glad to have ordered fingerling potatoes on the side to balance it out.   Where this place really excels is in its mixology. I love a gin martini and this place introduced me to the wonder of Death's Door gin in a martini - really smooth with a hint of vanilla. Though I usually go for clear spirits, this time I had an Encore, a concoction including Japanese whisky, strawberry vermouth, and balsamic glaze which was tangy and delightful. In every cocktail I've had here, each ingredient has really shone. The cocktail menu seems to change seasonally - find one with a couple of ingredients you like and give it a go.  All in all the meal I had this time wasn't quite as great as on past visits, but I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Table setting &amp; an encore cocktail

-vnsHUempzfruZfZa8fBxw.text: Love this little gem of a restaurant off the beaten path in Edinburgh. Have a delicious lunch, dinner or even a glass of wine in the bar without tourists and crowds.

5UOP1UPVu7-w4jFUWKbvZQ.text: Amazing! Atmosphere is great, drinks were great and the lamb that I had was out of this world!

2cxbZFqhg_MDYjcdeU1HlQ.text: In a hidden alley, near the castle and shopping is this gem.  Great selection of scotch snd top quality food with good service.  Seated quickly and got our food is a very reasonable time.  Hot, delicious and good value.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. table
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

AdhQo1omaWQBU_B2ZQXkWw.text: We heard about Resturant on our tour around Scotland. They said it was the best restaurant in Edinburgh. We made reservations and went while in town. They did not disappoint. Nice relaxing dinner. Everyone in our party got the same dish, the beef brisket. Waiter said by far that was his favorite. It was truly amazing. Tender and tasty. They also had a wonderful selection of wines, beers and of course Whiskey. Highly recommend!

yO49oVZVxpmv8VW7lIm0FA.text: A fun walk down to a very stylish space for upscale clientele. Very friendly, kind staff made us feel very welcome. Had the Cullen Skink, Smoked Fish Board, and the  Grilled Ribeye with chips (fabulous chips). All very good. I took the recommended whiskey (excellent) and nursed it through out the meal (I'm a lightweight). We made our reservation on Thursday before noon for 5pm Friday evening. No waiting!

sWB6hs1TXTtlkTP9qKeyLg.text: We had gotten a recco for this place from a bartender in London and happened to stumble upon it one day.  Thought we'd pop in for a dram and ended up staying a few hours.  The whisky list is impressive as expected but the service was fantastic.  We chatted with one of the bartenders who I would guess is also the manager and he was incredibly enthusiastic about whisky.  Very generous with advise and tasting.  We ended up ordering the scallops and serrano and were very pleased with the quality of the scallop dish.  It was delicious.  Can't really mess up serrano but the bread they served with it was fresh and the olive oil very good.  Can't wait to go back.

RCOWNk_rt1sYjVogFU441A.text: Really nothing to write home about other than the ambiance and the cool location in the alley. Drink menu is great but the food menu is very limited. If you are a vegetarian, stay home. I ordered the whole fish grill of the day and the dish was soaked in oil/butter. Super oily. The chicken linguini was very chewy. Very strange. The manager was very stuck up and should lighten up a bit and be more hospitable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

c7nmu3bCOuQdgH5jUv2yJQ.text: The staff is some nice people to say the least. They make you feel at home and in a relaxing environment. We are from the US and this place reminds us of a bar by our home. Try it out and see what we mean.

l1YsfUNBW3Is5ncCavGEwg.text: Eh wow. How friggin gorgeo is this place.  First of all, if you're going from the high road, you have to step through one of those little laneways that seems like it's going nowhere but turns out to be like a portal into a whole other old Edinburgh world. Also the laneway is called Advocate's Close which I thought was kinda cool. (Laneways and passageways and doors into streets - jeez Edinburgh you're mad covert)  Anyway. Back to the Devil's Advocate. The name is quite apt as it's a tempting dark spot with lots of naked flames around (gorgeous candles. If hell is like this, sign me up tbh). It's got that perfect mix of old and new - contemporary finishes over old, old stone. It envelopes you as soon as you go in and makes it rather difficult to leave.   They have an incredible selection of whiskeys. And knowledgeable and sound bar staff who can explain and recommend each and every one to you.  I didn't get to try the food but I bet it's great.   It's all bloody great. Go. You just might not ever leave...

CgR-xnY_dk5XYLjWlwFEig.text: Nice ambience with candle light ,stone and wood . Friendly service and the best pork chop I've ever eaten in my life!

58NAsIJThzYmo4BgPcMWNg.text: It's a 3 start restaurant.   Very hipster posh, upmarket & slightly on the snobby side. Like what is this pretend wanna be an LA bistro?   The food was average at best. However The ambience is nice and location is close to city center.   The waiting staff had a bit of an attitude if I'm honest. But I was hoping the food would wow me. But it was fairly bland.   But good for drunk people I guess ;)

x-ygwg9YHCnQgG-bvIF4cw.text: Colour me impressed! I'd heard nothing but good things about the Devil's Advocate but hadn't had the chance to try it out yet (I was gutted to miss Yelp Edinburgh's 3rd Birthday Bash here!), but then my mum was through and I met her for a drink before she got the train home. And where better located for a pre-Waverley-pick-me-up than DA?  You'd never know it was here if you started wandering up Advocate's Close from Cockburn Street, but then you turn the corner and voila! The space inside is lovely, I can only assume that it's been used as storage space for years, as a lot of the lower buildings of the closes have, and it still retains a bare feeling inside, with exposed walls complimented by warm woods and metals.  Alas as it was Burn's Night they were not serving food (other than the special Burn's menu for those who'd already booked), so no light bites for us, just drinks. The cocktail menu caught our eyes straight away - there are none of your traditional drinks on it (though I assume they'd make you a margarita if you asked for one), but everything sounds delicious and is helpfully sorted into sections like 'Sippers' with subsections of 'Short', 'Long' and 'Up'. We both plumped for the Whiskey Swizzle, which was delicious. I cannot remember what was in it (other than a rye whiskey), but it was fragrant, refreshing and had a good amount of kick to it.  We did only stay for one drink, but I'll definitely be back and my mum is already talking of bringing my dad here next time they're through. If this is where the Devil's legal representative drinks, then this law grad has gone to the dark side.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whiskey Swizzle.

TKvz8-roGoyBuaNScXkceQ.text: Waited for 10 minutes for the hostess to show up only to learn they won't seat people who want to dine alone. Don't know about the food but I've never been refused service at a restaurant because I wanted to eat alone.

gFliaqxxQ4qzs0GvxP0Oyw.text: This place is good. We got the haggis Bon Bons to start and they were good. I got the burger and it was decent- not the best burger I've had but it was definitely unique. I couldn't taste the pork belly but having black pudding on a burger was definitely interesting.  The fries that came with the meal weren't very good. The potato was maybe a tad under cooked.  The bf had the fish of the day (which was essentially fish and chips).  He thought it was good- I had a bite and wasn't too impressed but to each his own. It was served atop a bed of smashed peas- again interesting, but not the most complimentary combination in my opinion.   We had the chocolate tart for dessert and it was good- served with a scoop of strawberry ice cream. The chocolate is a bit strong, but it was fine for us.  What I love about this place is the ambience- Its romantic, small and borderline hipster. Reminds me a lot of Chicago.

hrw9_PsaUC1p-Qza8kTnuw.text: I went here with friends for drinks and the atmosphere is lovely. It's really intimate feeling and cozy. It really plays off the history of old town with the stone walls and candles.  The beers there are great. Not the type you have at every bar. The cocktails are great. It's a bit pricey so a good place to go for a classy catch up or a relaxed yet snazzy date.

CNvd7GjJm9uqcEDvOw0gTA.text: The meal I had at this restaurant was the best meal I ate on my entire 2 week vacation in Europe.   We ordered a lamb burger, a roast beef salad (full size) and two Thistley Cross Whiskey Cask Ciders.  The burger was perfectly cooked, and was absolutely delicious. It came with chips that were amazing, and was topped with some kind of grilled onions that were to die for.   The roast beef salad was just as good, and came with a hearty portion of roast beef, mixed greens, perfectly ripe cherry tomatoes, soft boiled eggs, and some kind of balsamic dressing.   I also highly recommend the cider we ordered, it was probably the best drink I've ever had.   The restaurant itself is just as appealing as its food. It has a very dark and trendy theme, which fits well with it. Their drink menu is as thick as a bible, and the staff was really friendly and welcoming.   Make sure you call and make a reservation because it gets packed! We went on a Tuesday and we had to wait 30 minutes for a table.   If you live in or are visiting Edinburgh then definitely stop by the Devils Advocate for drinks and dinner, you will not be disappointed.

nmvPxqmGSD1u5YX2aN7ujw.text: Just popped in for a drink & got a wee table upstairs on the mezzanine level. Service was prompt. Nice vibe but does get very noisy when full due to the low ceiling.  Great selection of cocktails. I had the "pick a pear" one & it was lovely.  Looking forward to working my way through the rest of the menu :-)

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Risotto. Yum.

RSJWmKIxDuP4v92O582vyA.text: Went for dinner but it was booked out. Returned the next day for lunch and was seated within 15 minutes. Their selection of cocktails all looked appealing but landed on the Dirty Mess and was not disappointed. The atmosphere is very cool and industrial. Love the bartenders wearing their bartender aprons. Had the fish and chips which was quite large and appreciated the half-pint of beer available. Glad we were able to grab a meal here!

vCKwLDktc4ra-PhDU4OPCA.text: Great service from the bar seating. The drinks were on point, and the snacks were delicious for the whole adult family at a reasonable price. The server brought me a bowl of olives, even when they didn't serve it on the menu. Highly recommend!

_cv55F_nyWcNV5BmpDR7Bw.text: Wonderful spot off Advocate's Close on the Royal Mile. It was booked out solid so we had to beg for a reservation - which the manager took care of with a smile. Such a great vibe inside. Excellent cocktail selection and the meals were tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ribeye &amp; Filet Tails
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Monkey Shoulder Old Fashioned
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

x1gI2rozIPp5hDkrJiNbVg.text: Is it the scotch here in Edinburgh or am I just lucky? I keep writing 5 star reviews and I promise I am sober. Devils advocate is no exception! Great cocktails and really tasty food! They do know they are good, but are not too cocky... just wish I made reservations cause they are always full!

fRxEeisft-8EKK5CzS2efA.text: The Devil's Advocate's motion in declaration of tastiness is granted. Ok sorry, lame joke. But this place is great. Friendly/knowledgable bartenders, good cocktails, beer, and liquor selection plus a fine menu. My bartender was very honest when I asked him for his dish/beer recommendation. I got the beef cheeks and marrow pie, which was excellent. The large amounts of marrow and connective tissue gave it the semi-sticky mouthfeel of ox-tail. The bartender said he'd normally get a stout with it, but the stout of the day wasn't great and recommended a different beer (an IPA).

zyQXhX9iWmZsUx1xGqvgGQ.text: This place was amazing..... The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the time it took to get our cocktails. Amazing place for tourists to visit****

7WIeHRuQO5Z-l9nUgmhiaQ.text: The Devil's on my shoulder, and I've got his back!  It gets great reviews because it is consistently great. Some people might think it is a bit hipster, but I don't agree with that. Yeah they have beards tattoos and wear braces, but wait and just look at the clientele, it's popular with everyone - even that American tourist with the NY giants jacket on.  This place is cool, not effortlessly as a lot of thought has gone into it, but they certainly aren't trying too hard either. Listen if you like traditional, then this probably isn't your spot, and if you like uber modern, the same goes - try the royal mile or George Street respectively.   Great drinks selection, from cracking wines to an on trend beer range. The best part of the drinks list are their cocktails, it's a well thought out list perfectly executed every time. I like a bit of the speakeasy vibe, old school cocktails focused more on the base spirit and minus the gimmicks. Great structure to the food menu also makes this a very hard bar to move on from.

U4JvWX6PrpGWaNKyvTa4TA.text: Delicious food, amazing drinks, and beautiful atmosphere. The venison was to die for but the lamb dish was a little lacking. Overall though, really enjoyed the food and the mixed cocktails. OUr waitress seemed a little annoyed to be waiting on us and the place is pretty busy.

60u5i8iubWh_g_PTUVlcxg.text: We came in forty minutes before close one night. I found us a table while my husband went to the bar to get us drinks. We didn't see a waitress at the time and didn't want to keep them open any later than they had to be, although they were pretty full. A waitress came over when I found a seat and said they had table service, but "he already left....". We then didn't see her the rest of the night. Whoops!   There is no Guiness on tap. What.   Despite great reviews, we were not super impressed. The ambiance was great and we would have loved to give it another chance if there was Guiness on tap! That's a deal breaker.

b76wLysEn1pu6MbXWCvycg.text: I was a bit leery about his place because a YELP review mentioned that they played rap music too loudly. But I figured that I was in the land of Braveheart, so I thought I would give it a try. I was very glad I did.   The place is absolutely charming.  The alleyway entrance gives you a spectacular view of the city as you wind you way down the many steps to the entrance.  You walk in the doorway and the bar greets you with its magnificent backlighted wall of whiskeys. Magnificent.  Up the stairs you go for dinner. Our waiter Kelvin was an absolute delight and his recommendations were excellent. We had a wonderful and delicious experience, even if it was a bit difficult getting back up all the stairs that brought us down there in the first place. Ordinarily, I would give this place a 5, but the music selection was just terrible. Seriously, Don't serve delicious, amazing, Scottish food and drink and ask your patrons to listen to American pop music icons like Michael Jackson. Porter and whiskey don't taste as good when you are listening to "Billie Jean!  It's just so our of character!  PS Eat up as they don't allow you to take away what you cant finish.

c5Zm1UWaZuG3UNnQDbrcjw.text: Intimate setting, amazing food and great drinks and service! Try the pork chops and cured trout..they were sooooo good! I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a good place to eat in Edinburgh.

flliGejWVEOJthQDPRJHhg.text: I have been there only for drinks. Nice ambience and music that makes it feel like a bar. But only two stands to sit down at the bar area, meaning you will be standing for sure. Given the lack of classy bars in Edinburgh it is a good choice though.

hu2B4Mx0dK_IlQkgasRzlw.text: Food was outstanding, service was mediocre, but the environment so noisy that we couldn't have a conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips---that sauce was VERY good!
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Really...just look at that burger!

9nYC18Z5qbSIIK2Wfg8BbQ.text: I was here just a few days ago and while we absolutely adored the place, the drinks and the food, the overwhelming smell of BO (body odor) near ruined the night. You can't help it when it's from the guests but we noticed it on the servers too and it was so off putting. Perhaps it was a bad night but it seemed that it was palpable on more than one server. Regardless though, it's an adorable restaurant with a nice candle lit atmosphere and the food was really good. I had the polenta with the poached egg and devoured the entire dish. I'd go back and even recommend it despite the unpleasant odors.

P0UEcno6MSomGrat9_u6vA.text: This rustic restaurant was a surprising find down a little close (alley way) you'd miss it if you weren't looking. Absolutely amazing atmosphere Inside is rustic with lots of wood and stone. The service was great as well as the food! Would definitely go back!!

bAtHTuXUntvMxW0oHjDWcg.text: Stopped in for lunch. Had the squash curry. I was a little scared when she said it wasn't spicy because I hate sweet curry but it turned out to be perfect. The squash spears were deep fried which was different and delicious. The salad of the day was also great and a double of Laphroig Triple Wood topped it off nicely. Nice ambiance, good service, great food. Will probably come back one more time before I leave. Went back and had the watermelon gazpacho and a different sald du jour. Once again both excellent .

UCYEMMJOtOMla6e3lE-yMg.text: Great service, ambiance, food, and wine. Casual, intimate, and lively. Great for a date.

0euXtHZh8SHUsaqQKeYpbA.text: Oi, listen here dweebs. This place is next level. The drinks are well on point, quality all round. You can sit in here and have an awesome drink while listening to some great music. Ooorrrrrr you can stay for a feed and be absolutely impressed. The menu isn't extensive but legit every single item is done exquisitely. If you don't hit this place up while you're in Edinburgh you're a dumbass.

Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

euYz00xDkXW_PiFPBjVbfA.text: We stopped at the Devil's Advocate after a very long day of traveling. The place is in a very cool old building down a narrow path that cuts between buildings. The path is called "Advocate close."   The place was very busy and we found a couple seats at the bar. I have very little experience with Scotch Whisky. The bartenders were very helpful with choosing some different whiskies for me to try. They had a huge selection and seemed to know about all of them. I asked for something in the range of 5-6 pounds. When I got the bill noticed the few that I tried were only 4 pounds. I was happy they didn't go the other direction in price. There was about a 30 minute wait for a table for dinner. We asked if we could eat at the bar. With some checking with the manager, they were able to accommodate our request.   We started with a really good Salmon Salad and spilt an order of fish and chips. Overall we had a pretty good experience!

QibWkTzmU0Vbmqqc32njYQ.text: We came here on our first night in Edinburgh and we were on the Royal Mile when we decided to Yelp for a place to eat at. We found this place to be the closest to us and decided to give it a try, as the reviews are pretty good. The food was very good. Seasoned and prepared very well. The only gripe we had was the service. The service itself was good, but it was just slow. Service in n Europe is generally slower than in the US, but this was exceptionally slow. Will we return? Without a doubt, but snack a little first.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chocolate Brownie and Poached Pear
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lamb and Duck Breast
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ham and Cheese as starters

K0nbUyqdI43WXs0THUKxJw.text: I really really wanted to give The Devil's Advocate 5 full Stars.  It has everything I love.  An incredible atmosphere, a great Whiskey list and the best cocktails we had while in Edinburgh.  I had the Whole Sea Bass, which was wonderful.  My daughter had the roasted chicken, it was also delicious.  We ordered the Duck Fat Potatoes on the side.  It was included with the Duck dish, but was well worth asking for them to provide separately.    The reason for the 4 Star review, the Top Sirloin Steak.  It was well cooked, but had absolutely no flavor.    We'll definitely be back.  And I highly recommend The Devil's Advocate.  It will be a great spot to meet with friends and have some great drinks.

cugw40RJrXDxRZxUT6gOTA.text: Awesome trendy place in the old town. Great cocktails and vibe at the bar. We had dinner too and the service was friendly and attentive. The waiters even gave us recommendations of where to go out for a night on the town. Was a very nice experience.

I6ZK--ZtS23aEmhNNk_nkg.text: I am releatively new to Yelp, so this review is published a little in arrears....   I visted the Devil's Advocate this time last year with my partner for an anniversary, with the intentions of going to a nice meal in a quiet restaurant, on the other side of town (we are based at the West End.) The Devil's Advocate did not disappoint! The overall quality of service, food and drinks given the price tag was well justified, we were thoroughly looked after and everything was lovely. The overall atomosphere of the place as well is amazing, a little secluded but by no means does this make it a quiet place, with a good bustle of business about it, making you realise it must be good if people are going a little out of the way to visit! Would recommend to anyone looking to go for an intimate meal, or a few drinks at the bar area.

rYz6E8rAu5KsWP-5-iPKCA.text: Simple pub food. Everything was good to okay. Sorta expensive for what it is.   Service was a little overwhelmed on Saturday and struggling.   Super loud music. Not the best place for talking.

k04QLwoa1Rkvft770R3NrA.text: Oh #$%&. I'm going to keep this simple. One of the simplest restaurant settings to get you in the right mood. Dark, intimate, amazeballs.  The pork and chorico burger with crispy "chips" (For all us Americans, it's fries on the best kind of steroids) was gluttonous and unforgiving to my body.  If you don't go for the food, then you absolutely have to go for the drinks! The menu offers plenty of choices, and if you can't find something that you like (highly unlikely that this happens), ask any of the bartenders to whip you up something that tickles your fancy. I honestly can't picture them making a bad drink.  Love that this place is tucked away off the Royal Mile in an alley (a "close" if you're in Edinburgh). I'm a lucky gal that I stumbled across this while taking a shortcut back to the hotel. I've gone back every single time I've visited Edinburgh!

hs-hUCVec6kGyQseWTF7lw.text: Just got to town & tried this place based on others reviews. We were not disappointed!  Loved the atmosphere. Modern rustic.  Great food. Really friendly service too. Just take your time because the pace is slow here!  Overall a stellar first meal in Scotland.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Local lamb! Nicoise. Fabulous!
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Starter of cheese &amp; local ham

pUjv5JNiJfGOWJepsFFiIQ.text: Great bar with an amazing atmosphere. Haven't eaten there but their selection of gin and whiskey is amazing

-GX7SSTBFy3Bbm0lFVcdqg.text: Cool higher end place down a narrow close. Populated by a young affluent-looking after work crowd. Great drinks selections and seating on multiple levels.

vTGNDWsxVK8lZ48hDB7EoQ.text: This was a chance find one afternoon.  The sun was out and folks were sitting on the deck enjoying their libations.  It has a very cozy atmosphere and there are blankets outside to keep off the chill.  Dog friendly place.  Very laid back.  Good food.  The wine was fine.  It was a lovely place to pass the time.

NQFwQgEK5GjtgsBBRPUqmA.text: The mussels and the smoked salmon board are absolutely bomb! The plating of smoked salmon board is an work of art. It has a mysterious and chill vibe. The servers are very friendly and helpful. They gave us a charger to charge our phone, which saves our lives. Absolutely recommended.

i2fWuAZiZjd4xyBUX6z37Q.text: A bit hard to find (as you have to turn down Advocate's Close and go down some steep stairs to find it) but it was PACKED on a recent evening with all ages, locals and tourists alike. Just came in for drinks as we started on the patio upstairs but it got chilly so we came down to the bar area. Lots of beer and whiskey to choose from -- we liked all we tried and the bartenders were cool too.  REALLY OLD BUILDING TOO -- which is always a plus. Next time we'll try the food -- but all good here!

Gi-wxPblGUjbkskur18Sag.text: Won't seat without a reservation even if you'll wait.  They were dicks about it to boot

R_grZU1wKcuekBRfOkMRkg.text: Really nice atmosphere, great selection of whiskey and wine, staff uber polite and accommodating.   We had the soup of the day (to share) and it was actually suggested by our waiter; the mains amazing: brisket and mushroom polenta.   Thinking of coming back tomorrow evening.

c09P96fc33bQFUYF7QFC3w.text: Food was DELICIOUS. Everybody loved their meal. We split the whiskey flight that would be good for a whiskey lover but too much for someone who doesn't care for whiskey. Would absolutely recommend.

QHCgZMBTe7F0aiXEeY4gqw.text: From the name to the location, the ambiance, the food, the service everything was fantastic ! Our server Chevon was friendly, knowledgeable, and totally awesome! Best chips I ever had in The UK !    Chevon suggested a flight of scotch that was perfect, a bartender even came to the table and explained the different scotches and helped me to determine the aromas ! Great place a definite must stop when in Edinburgh!!!!!

Odj8_N2k61eqT1Wwgr0Xww.text: An amazing place to grab a bite and try some scotch. We stumbled on this place and spent a good two hours tasting whiskies, nibbling on appetizers and eating lunch. It's cozy inside, great atmosphere and wonderful, friendly staff. If you're in the area, this place is a sure thing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cozy, delicious lunch.
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Smokey Beasts Tasting List

3MXAHyRXinXqRJmGrO0tZQ.text: We honestly wouldn't have even known about this spot had my brother and his girlfriend not suggested it as our post-Arthur's Seat hike lunch spot. They'd had trouble finding it on their own a couple days before, so they figured four heads were better than two, and we found the restaurant in no time at all.  It was quite busy when we arrived, sweaty, hungry and thirsty. We hung out at the bar while we waited for our table (they said it'd be a 5-minute wait). The bartenders were friendly and handled the crush of people well. The thing that stunk was that of the 5 or 6 beers on tap, only three were available. And of course, the ones that we wanted to try were the ones that were sold out.  The wait was significantly longer than 5 minutes, which wasn't terrible because we had good beer and good company to while away the time. We were squeezed into a small table for four at the top of the stairs. It was cozy, but at least we had a place to get our food on.  Our waitress was also friendly, but it felt like she was a bit overrun with the number of people on that second floor. We ordered their meat and cheese platter (what they called the "Ploughman's"). I ordered the Highland Park 12 Ribs, and my husband ordered the Cashew & Chickpea Curry. My brother and his girlfriend had eaten a late breakfast, so they decided to share the fish and chips.  We all shared and loved the meat and cheese platter. It offered a good variety of cheese and pickles, as well as bread and meats.  The ribs were good, but I didn't taste the whisky; it was definitely overpowered by the BBQ flavor and didn't shine through. The sauce also overpowered the flavor of the meat, which was disappointing.   My husband actually ordered the curry because he wanted a vegetarian and non-fried-food meal. He said the curry was delicious, but the plate actually came with two large deep-fried pieces of squash, which he didn't end up eating.  My brother and his girlfriend seemed to enjoy their shared meal - my brother cleared his plate, her plate, the meat and cheese plate and some of the ribs off of my plate. He didn't touch the deep-fried squash because "it's vegetables", haha.  We did enjoy our time there, though it took much longer for us to get our drinks, eat and get out of there than we had hoped and planned on. We would go back if we visit the city again. We'd at least go back to see their draft beer selection.

76x0rtGDTpAEjOPv5RW2wg.text: Just a great spot to have a beer, some fish and chips and take in Edinburgh -- great atmosphere and a cheerful staff to boot.

VXoqKPI8gYKtWbUK9F6blg.text: Great meal while staying on Royal Mile in Edinburgh.  A short walk down Advocates close but definitely worth the walk. I particularly enjoyed the whiskey sampler.

4qtoOETEmvxl7K1VqcGZtg.text: Drinks are absolutely spectacular. We tried almost everything in the menu... they were all mouth watering!!! We couldn't get up and leave we just wanted more and more!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Signature cocktail
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bar area

kFNCVlpG9JBquHKbRJY5Yg.text: My first impression was complete surprise!  I heard it was good but it exceeded my expectations.  Off the path for sure and you need to walk into the close to get to it but you feel like you entered into a hidden lair.  In my opinion, the food was excellent.  Interesting menu with not too many options where you would get lost in trying to decide on what you wanted.  The service I experienced was excellent. The waiter was very attentive and provided some stellar recommendations.  I was really fond of the salmon charcuterie which is a nice departure from the typcal stuff you see at most other restaurants.  One interesting item cod and curried cauliflower!  This was a hit and I need to make it at home (or at least try).  I will be back here for sure.  Overall, I would recommend the Devil's Advocate the next time you visit Edinburgh.

YZfE-ZoDZgCyBwzIX7ND9Q.text: Great upscale pub in an alley off a major street.  The ambiance was great here.  Low light levels and natural wood created a more intimate and warm setting.  We had the roasted pepper soup, Black haggis fritters and mushrooms &spinach for starters.   The soup was amazing, very rich and complex with flavor including the harissa.   The mushrooms were very nice.   The haggis was just ok.  I think frying it took away from the actual flavor of the haggis.  For entrees we had the fish and chips and the roasted cauliflower salad.   The cauliflower was fantastic and maybe too large of a portion.   The fish and chips were good.   The batter was a bit too thick and there were large gaps between the fish and batter.   Still pretty decent.  The service was very attentive and good here.   I would definitely return to try new items.

64YG2SFDojws8hH2YMIQFQ.text: 5 stars for food! 3 stars for service.  This place is to coziest spot for a cold, rainy night. I loved the vibe! They have a ton of whiskys to choose from and our waitress was very knowledgeable in helping us through it. The food menu is smaller but has so many yummy options. My husband and I both got the soup of the day (sweet potato) served with a huge slice of fluffy bread and then we shared a chicken dish that had sundried tomatoes and potatoes. I LOVED the chicken, and am inspired to recreate it at home! 5 stars!!  The part of our evening that was annoying was the rush to get us out of the table. When I made the booking we were told we had the table for 2 hours - which is totally normal in Europe. I called later on to say we were running a half hour late but promise to have the table back by the end of our slot (9pm). When we arrived and sat down at 7:30 the waitress told us we needed to leave by 9. Got it, told her we knew that and that would be no problem. I think we told her that and another server we knew that about 5 times. It was SO annoying to keep being reminded! We told them we understood so their was NO need for the constant reminder. It really was frustrating. And like we had promised we were out before 9pm with extra time to spare!

X53nrpmb2UuQS221sRvNcA.text: We spent a few days in Edinburgh and this was top on my list to visit! The food is incredible and the service was awesome! I would say as far as value goes, the food is quality at an affordable rate. It was four adults plus cocktails and it totaled to $180 in USD which included a tip. I would recommend calling to book your table beforehand. Otherwise you will not be seated!

Ez7yjj_aQvAZ5i0QqKtYIQ.text: Love this place!!  The atmosphere is excellent.  The scotch list phenomenal (but the three staff members we asked for recommendations seemed weak on the subject).  Cameron, our waiter on day 2, picked a great wine to pair with the burger (both were amazing).  The haggis, the boards, the locale, the ambiance - all fantastic!!  Would give it 4.5 stars!

6cMYvIlrBOgfDjbzGgMz7g.text: Haggis was a lot better than I imagined, though this is a pretty classy joint to try it in.  I spoiled myself to some scotch, crispy haggis and the cod. Everything was delicious including the white wine I ordered. The dtaff are friendly and this has potential for a very romantic dinner experience.  I would go back anytime I want to treat myself.

ZSE4K1VksB_ugyTKl93bdg.text: We waited for over 40 minutes for our food. The fried haggis tasted surprisingly good. The fish is overcooked. The pineapple dessert is just canned fruit in a jar.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

lXm-Re53LCn1Fshr-PL6vg.text: The haggis burger at this place is the best in all of Edinburgh. Highly recommend it.

zdVobvU-wfOdzxVoTV6BIw.text: I was drawn by the craft cocktail list and proximity to our hotel. Also, they're owned by the same group as Bon Vivant and El Cartel, which were recommended to us for their bars.   Drinks: - Duck, you sucker: sun-dried tomato infused rye, fig port, lemon, celery bitters - light and not too sweet or acidic  - Spice trade: like a whisky Bloody Mary with a good kick  - Scotch by the dram prices were reasonable   Food (lunch): - Tomato fennel soup: with sourdough. The bread was grilled but without oil or butter, so it tasted a bit like tobacco. The soup itself was a good texture and wasn't overly acidic. I like that it was not cream based  - Burger: on brioche, with cheddar and bacon. The beef had a good char grilled flavor, and I like that it was a tomato jam rather than ketchup on it. Fries were thin and salted well - Gnocchi: crisped / fried for more texture. It came with lots of vegetables (whole green onion, zucchini, eggplant, micro greens). It was a great dish that's vegetarian friendly   Cocktails are 7-10 each.   Notably: the decor is cool with all the stone and brick - I guess it was an old pump house.  For nicer weather, they have outdoor seating, too.

ZZtDmHtNg7MLr_CJ0IahqQ.text: Incredible food, drink selection and service.   Miserably let down by the unnecessarily blaring rap music (and don't get me wrong I'm a fan of rap but this is not the place for music one has to shout over, regardless of genre...)  Would come back only if I didn't have to yell at the person sat next to me at one of the many, very cramped tables.

uDTc_MQXSIy1UM3XLfZUYA.text: Head down the winding steps deep in to the heart of old Edinburgh and you will find The Devil's Advocate, a bar like no other.  Going to The Devils Advocate is like crossing over in to a mythical enchanted land. Through the large barn like doors and into a candlelit cave you are presented with a dark, rustic bar with exposed brick work - then to contrast this almost moody decor a smiling bubbly hipster member of staff bounces over and asks us where we would like to sit. It becomes clear at this point that this is not a simple bar but much more of an experience.  The drinks menu is full of mad scientist style beverages with ingredients jammed together that on reading you couldn't possibly imagine how they would infuse to create something that was even drinkable. On first perusal I was unsure of what to order but when I mentioned to the friendly member of staff that I loved rum he came up with a suggestion that included; Havana Club, Stout and Egg! I know what you're thinking, was this drinkable? Unbelievably it was, although it must be said that it was more like eating a desert than having a drink, but I didn't mind this at all - in fact I wish I had been given a spoon!   My visit was all to brief and next time I'm back in Edinburgh I will definitely be getting my compass out and navigating back to The Devil's Advocate.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. So medieval!
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Devil&#39;s Advocate is absolutely enchanting!

PRpGSWckfcy-wmE15rsQBQ.text: We chose this place on reviews alone and it did not disappoint.  Atmosphere is outstanding with a great location down one of the side alleys off The Royal Mile.  Staff was very pleasant and accommodating.  Drinks were excellent along with the charcuterie appetizer which offered a top quality selection of meats, cheese and other treats.  Pork chop and ribeye entrees were absolutely excellent; well prepared and flavorful.  Desserts were unique and outstanding.  Prices are a bit speedy but the place offers a fantastic experience.

bSs1tb9dDY1FJopL7O2WNA.text: This was our favorite place in Edinburgh. Great quaint location down a close, charming/rustic inside, bartender was knowledgeable and the dining/food experience upstairs sealed the deal.  Food was hearty and delicious.  We both had the broccoli soup, fish and chips and salad.  Everyone was pleasant that worked there.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

wo9b_1J9rcm7VxGFi8DkDg.text: It has finally happened, my first 5 star rating.  And every star is deserved.  Service. The difference between a good, great, or perfect place is in the amount of skill and knowledge involved.  The staff know their stuff.  Knowing a bit of whisky, I am impressed because there is not much I haven't yet tried.  I know what I like and what I don't.  Seldom if ever is it that I ask for a recommendation and I get something wondrous.  The Islay Old fashioned.  I was mildly astonished with the immaculate fInish on this.  Bartender explained every step to what he was making and was curious as to what malts I preferred.  Few questions later, he had my mind read.     The dry rob roy with Peat Monster.  Thought I had the best of the night with the previous drink.  This was in its own right, impeccable.   Other drinks had were neat single malts.  They house a desirable selection of whiskies, which arouse my envy.   It was a busy Saturday night as usual but even with just standing at the bar, we were perfectly content chatting away with great drinks.  A staff member even offered us a table twenty minutes later, saying seats opened up.  We politely passed on the offer, but it was amiable nonetheless.    Everyone in the bar were pleasant company, resulting in a medium background buzz in small group conversations.  Excellent drinks, good venue & tone, impeccable service. I felt my libations more than satisfied.

Cp4bdaD_yntwGuxtImMzxQ.text: I was excited to try this place after I found it on several lists highlighting 'go to' whisky places to try while in Edinburgh.  Let me tell you, those lists did not lie, and this place did not disappoint. Over 200 whiskies in house (according to what I've read).   The place is located down Advocate's Close pretty close to the top of the Royal Mile.  You would never suspect that anything was down this sleepy little side alley. I arrived around 7pm on a Saturday, and it was hopping!  I had only one goal in mind, and that was trying a few different whiskies. I made my way to the bar and was amazed at the wall of liquor.  How do the reach the ones way up at the top??!!?   One barman in particular was very helpful at walking me through their whisky menu.  I described the type of whisky I liked, and he was happy to bring down a few options and let me choose.  He also taught me the 'proper' way to drink whisky (with a water dripper to adjust the whisky), which is something I've never seen back in America.  I tried three whiskies, and I really enjoyed two of them.  Best part was the value - judging from the final tally, I probably payed 4-5 per glass on average.  It would cost 2x as much back in the States!   Their cocktail menu is also impressive, as is watching the very talented barmen make the drinks with a steady, precise hand.  These guys are truly masters at their craft, as some of the drinks take several minutes to make.    Thank you Devil's Advocate for the whisky instruction and suggestions, and thank you Edinburgh for your affordable whisky!  I will return to Edinburgh, and I will call again at your fine establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky wall!
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Advocates Close

Gj7SfOQplDmDKasdqMM2MQ.text: I visited the Devil's Advocate today for a lovely boozy lunch and it did not disappoint. There was a veggie butternut squash option on the lunch menu - however not fancying this I went for a medley of veggie starters and sides. I opted for mushrooms on toast, chips and side salad and it was mega tasty. We shared a bottle of White Burgundy, which was buttery, smooth and unoaked - unfortunately it was also 29 per bottle. Here's the sting with this place - they are expensive - especially the wines which ranged from about 23 to 60. However, it is just off a main tourist spot in Edinburgh - so I guess that's to be expected. The service was attentive and we had an awesome waiter who advised us well with our dessert option - the Buffalo Trail cocktail - refreshing and tasty. An awesome spot - but they could introduce a couple more affordable wines to their menu.
