dC72hXi77NGGoylZ1IJ-hA.text: Came here on Yelps recommendation for food, but arrived too early for the kitchen (which opens at 5pm).   Staff were friendly and we decided to have a drink while waiting for kitchen to open. Our "booth" was slapped into a corridor on the way to the bathroom and we were uncomfortably close to the table beside us - whose graphically sexual conversation set an uncomfortable atmosphere.   We left after one round and found food elsewhere. In short, menu looked good and staff were friendly but overall was compact and uncomfortable.

GMo7MolhH0cWJBf_xHPzkQ.text: My friend and I went for an afternoon drink, and we fell in love with this place.   I ordered Modern Era from the cocktail menu which was whisky-based with lemon juice, egg yolk, ginger beer, bitters, etc. I LOVED it.   Ambience is amazing as well. My type of place absolutely -- warehouse type of feel but sophisticated and hip.   Service was awesome as well. We were seated immediately at a barrel, which added to the speakeasy type of experience, and our waitress was very helpful and kind.   Definitely recommend this place for drinks -- at anytime of the day!

8Gi8b_mBzdjKxIwwOu26dA.text: OMG. This restaurant is, as states above, superb. The drink selection = excellent. The service = excellent. The location = excellent. The vibe/ambiance = excellent. The food? The food is AMAZING. Had the short rib dinner (Jacob's Ladder) and is could not be beat. I insist on trying different restaurants while in a new city to get as much different experience as I can, but we actually had dinner here both nights we were in town, which is unheard of! I would recommend making a reservation as I could easily see this place filling up quick. Wish I could rate this place higher!

5KFlrlbLve1oFfGLG9qu0g.text: This restaurant and bar in the Old Town area offers over 100 whiskies as well as other satisfactory options, including food if you would like a post-dinner snack.  For whisky, sample the Glenmorangie Nectar D'or.  If you're more in the mood for a cider, try the locally produced Thistly Cross.

tR51iR7c1bTr0khSNyv3Yg.text: Hidden in a covered alley, The Devil's Advocate is a wonderful gem in the city. Go for the ambiance, stay for the wine!

0bddhbMgrzNqxRG8b11p0g.text: Have the butternut squash dish.... Very good!  Great hidden location. Good ambience ... Recommended as its off the tourist path!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

koX2nubuu7leZRUdm4w_Pw.text: The ribeye here is one of the best I've had in EU!  I highly recommend the cocktails - had the rashomon, double standard, and mangoes into a bar.  Service was awesome as they recommended excellent selection of Scotch for me, they have over 200 on the menu!  Call ahead to make sure you get a table as this place is very busy esp on weekends.

Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scotch menu fist page

ffoVpTwhHLlYpjrk6nrByQ.text: I had the pork chops plus a side of greens. The pork chop was delicious, with a drizzle of a sweet potato sauce that I thought was an interesting compliment to the pork. I could have appreciated both separately, but they were delicious regardless. The greens were very salty but perfectly cooked, so I was still able to enjoy it with a lot of water. I was also given a recommendation for a cocktail that had pineapple in it, and even though I'm not a huge fan of pineapple, I enjoyed it very much.   Somewhat hidden in an alley in Edinburgh, it is an amazing find! If I'm ever back in Edinburgh, I will definitely come here again!

ItdqGiKXwJMRGkc_16okrQ.text: This is by far one of the best meals we've enjoyed in years. So much so that we're coming back here tomorrow evening.

FLzRw3EogOzIfbwSWQGqrw.text: I'm in love with the Devil's Advocate! The food is outstanding, the drinks are delicious, but the thing I love the most is the atmosphere. Perfectly cozy, perfectly Scottish but with a modern flair. I wish I could go back, but alas, I live in the U.S. Definitely check this place out.

q8wpC9hE1bD4yNxw7Ojdug.text: Cozy yet modern space inside a seemingly historic building with a great atmosphere. Service is attentive and knowledgeable and the food is delicious. Well priced whiskey tastings, try the Unpronounceables.

hz_KJZ0LYfb7aaSc6OjbWw.text: This was one of our top two favorite places in Edinburgh.  Atmosphere was on par, staff was very attentive - we went for lunch and walked right through to our seats with the server upon walking in!  The food was a new wave style to some classic dishes - really appreciated the style of the menu, options, etc.  I got the curry which was perfect to warm up after a long afternoon of walking in the Scotland winter - plus very flavorful!  Wish we were there longer, we'd go again!

kyyKJHxscGTOjI5FK9cJxg.text: When we travel, we try not to return to places multiple times so as to get as many places as possible. Well, we broke that rule for Devil's Advocate.  We got a couple cocktails the first day. Unfortunately I've forgotten specific names but one was a smokey whisky with some chocolate bitters and it was fantastic.  We also got a mint whisky cocktail that tasted like thin mint girl scout cookies.   The vibe is perfect, some barrels and a huge back bar of liquours. Great interior and great service.  We didn't try the food, but it looked great.   Superb cocktail options. Creative menu, will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mint/whisky cocktail and a smokey whisky cocktail

gHl8r_yL6844bAjp91wRzQ.text: The ambiance was superb! Located on a little side street off the royal mile, it really makes you feel like you were transported in time to the 16th century. Be aware there are several steps and steep incline. The restaurant it self was beautiful! All stone and wood with modern touches. Now the food! I started off with the soup of the day which wa as pea, leek and zucchini soup. Was a little under seasoned and so I wasn't very impressed. But to make up for it I had the most beautifuly cooked piece of cod I have ever had!! Flaky, buttery seared cod with a light coconut curry and lemongrass sauce with shaved fresh coconut. It was really delicious!  The service was outstanding very attentive

BQUDm_p9g5yAcXTjuVAipA.text: Honestly, the food was excellent, but I am giving a low review based on how we were treated by the management. From the moment we sat down, we were rushed to order our food so we could be out before the next table arrived. Two of our guests were late because of a ScotRail cancellation, and the remaining 4 of us apologized and explained the situation the situation whilst ordering starters and plenty of drinks.  We were approached by the manager twice, eventually forcing us to order our entrees. Our server nervously paced behind our table the entire time, needlessly coming over to remove items fill water cups in what felt like continued pressure to hurry. Remaining guests finally showed up, they were thrown two menus and forced to order on the spot. After all that, we still had to move to a table adjacent to where we were sitting for the final 15 minutes of our rushed meal.   Oh yeah, and by the time we paid our substantial check, the other party that was apparently so important had no even shown up.

p7mcM11ogZLvyThJ_j-VQA.text: No matter what number of enneagram test results you fall under, I believe that you will like The Devil's Advocate.   1.  Do you like beer? 2.  Do you like nostalgically historic buildings down enchanting alleyways? 3.  Do you like a lively fun atmosphere? 4.  Are you a fan of pubs and good food?  If you have answered "yes" to any of the questions above... this place is for you.   The beer is fantastic and the ambiance is great. The whimsical spot makes for a great dinning experience. Love the design of this place and the layout.   My boyfriend and I were prompted to make a reservation and I am glad that we did. We started with the Cullen Skink. It was rich, creamy, and delightfully warming. He enjoyed the braised beef brisket, mashed potato, maple glazed carrots and garlic chips. I had the rump fillet and it was cooked more on the rare side---still good. We don't have any complaints here.   When you try this place make sure you raise a pint!  I'll toast you from the bar.

c9i7PRvxk-hCRptC1Am2Kw.text: Came here around 3pm for a late lunch, and the restaurant wasn't that full but it still took me 5 minutes to be seated. The servers were super friendly and informative, as they helped me select my whiskey - there were just so many options here! They had hundreds of different whiskeys to try!  In the end, I got one of the more basic / beginner whiskies (sorry, I don't remember which one exactly) and boy was it a great whisky! Even though I don't have much experience, it beats what I've drank in Canada and the USA. It tasted good, but was still quite strong!  I had the crispy black haggis as a starter! And boy was it better than I thought, the outside was deep fried so that's where the "crispy" came from. The inside actually tasted quite good, even though I was expecting something gross and nasty, but they seasoned and cooked it really well here, and it exceeded my expectations!  For the main, I had the Tweed Valley burger, and boy, this was one of the best burgers I've ever had. It's super juicy, tasty, delicious and greasy, but the good beef kind of grease. Everything about the burger was good, the bacon and the bread, just everything. And the chips were so delicious. They were freshly made chips and so fluffy with great texture - salted and fried perfectly!  This restaurant is so good, I'd definitely recommend. And when I'm back in Edinburgh, I'd love to try this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tweed Valley beef burger, cheddar, smoked bacon, baby gem, tomato relish, mayonnaise, hand cut chips £16
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Crispy black haggis, apple, raisins and chicory - £8
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky!

0bvrYarTnn8V9bqg5C-CtQ.text: A very busy spot that is well worth the wait. We arrived for a late dinner and sat at the bar area waiting for a table.   The drinks menu is pretty extensive with some great options. The service is on point and in a great location. We started with the red pepper soup and had the beef brisket which was delicious!! Full of flavour and just great. We ended off with a great chocolate and caramel dessert which was just great.   Check them out for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beef brisket

PzAM53friOA707nZ9pjitQ.text: Very good food!  The cod and chicken were both amazing. Service was incredible as always.  Will be back for sure!

8cvjE3lyHJyQF1G89JTmBA.text: I've only been here a couple of times, but loved it each time. Great food, good wine, and a nice atmosphere. I love how it is a little quirky. You do need to make a reservation as it does get busy.  If you're just going for drinks it is table service, which I like as it means it doesn't get too crowded. Make sure to try the olives...

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

5DAyyrn7B_eeLok0DnhHdw.text: Chips were good, fish was forgettable. We tried this sampler platter and there were a number of things I liked. Crispy Black Haggis was interesting.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Crispy Black Haggis

S9m-n8ciWNvWJZbnk3TQeA.text: All of the food was lovely. A group of us were in town for the Edinburgh Marathon and Half Marathon. Got a reservation easily a few days prior. Great ambience and food!

fbh_6jaCOAwfEhbf0_DjMA.text: If in Edinburgh, STOP searching and make a reservation HERE!!! You will not be disappointed ...   This place packed a punch! Service, Ambiance, Food and Cocktails - what more can you ask for?!   Located down a few staircases, nestled in a perfect little location with downstairs, upstairs, and patio seating - this places was definitely one of my favorite stops on my trip!   Our server was absolutely incredible! The food was great and the whisky selection and cocktails served were amazing!   Haggis was cooked perfectly, Rare Beef starter was quite flavorful and both entrees were great: Pichana and Lamb Rump! The Pichana was seriously amazing - the best thing there in my opinion and the sauce provided with the lamp that was drizzled in the place was seriously delicious!   A MUST if ever in the area!   Have your server make her own coffee concoction for you - it will be great after dinner!

ySYFQqIdPuvMlSSI7ci91A.text: Loved eating here. The food was amazing! The service was beyond great and the drinks were phenomenal. We got the taste of Scotland and I now have a new favorite whiskey. Each one of the staff makes sure you are taken care of! Definitely a great experience for the whole family or a night out with the gals. Books up pretty quick so make sure you make your reservation a day before. We tried to walk in and that wasn't happening!

yRIBzMdEA_jkOKuxwgaYGw.text: Beyond knowledgeable bar staff for whiskey, excellent food, wonderful atmosphere. After a long day of sightseeing, it was a delight.

GYl9kN_vW-neopD5jmfPBw.text: Fun pub with several levels and a lot of drinks options. Nicely decorated, a terrace and from what I could see a good menu too.

CnngQl0AJHtRu2Y7HWIw-A.text: Really the best meal we've enjoyed in Edinburgh center. Our service was outstanding but that is nothing compared to the food!! Wow! The chef truly honors the ingredients available in a way that speaks to the locale, the heritage and the people of Scotland.  This is a Do Not Miss if you find yourself in Scotland make your way here for seriously the meal of the year. In addition to the over 300 Scotch Whiskey list you will find a lovely wine list from Austria to California. We could not be happier and I plan to book in for a dinner as well.  Recommend reserving a table for either lunch or supper- you will NOT be disappointed.  The building is incredibly historic with amazing stone work, worn from centuries of use, the fresh lit (and real) candles the rustic tables and the absolute authenticity of the period shine through like you arrived off the boat from England to claim your seat at the table. I'm hooked.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Building

OrnuNXgbZEoruDm8QUjNUA.text: The last three times I've been to Edinburgh, I have wanted to eat at The Devil's Advocate. We always ended up having drinks but not being able to get food since it was always so slammed. I really enjoyed the cocktails we had, specifically mine. It was strawberry flavored and tart. Unfortunately I forget the name. While stopping in for that drink, we grabbed reservations for our last night and I am so glad I did.   The servers were all very kind and friendly. After sitting down, we perused the menu for a bottle of wine and our appetizers. I chose the soup of the day with thick sliced bread.  It was a puree of tomatoes and roasted red peppers. The bread was fresh and the butter, as always, delicious.    For my meal, I went with the chicken breast topped with pine nuts, tomato, olives and roasted potatoes.  It was cooked perfectly, still juicy and very well seasoned. It was probably one of my favorite meals in Edinburgh because the flavors were so unique. My **fiancee** (that is brand new so I am using it haha) got a really good cut of cod, which even I enjoyed. My mother had the pork chop with kraut and pureed yams. Pork is difficult (for me) to cook but it was tender and delicious. My father got the rib eye with chimichuri sauce. They said it was one of their favorite meals as well since it tasted so homemade. I can't wait to come back to have it again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. My delicious cocktail with Chuck&#39;s in the background
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken with toasted pine nuts, tomato and olives
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Soup of the day. Tomato and roasted red pepper.

oyihv_TdxhReivkRDdYjTA.text: The Advocate was recommended by a friend & they didn't disappoint!  Between the steps (with great views if you turn around) & dark, mysterious alleys, the walk here was an adventure.  You walk into the bar area which is an open floor with some high top tables.  Most of the dining tables are on the second level.    Great atmosphere (loud with great tunes) on a Friday night!  I arrived around 9 pm so seated right away but would recommend reservations during peak meal times.  The kitchen does close at 9:30 although they are open late.  I decided to go with a couple of starters vs getting an entree.  Started with the Crispy Haggis which was exceptional!  The Advocate's version with The roasted red pepper jam balanced perfectly with the salty of the Haggis.   Second starter was the small (perfect for one) Smoked Fish Board.  A nice mix of Lax, Smoked Salmon & Mussels with beet relish and pickles.  Excellent!   The Parmesan Truffle chips are a must try!  Paired it all with The Vienna Lager (local).  Service was also excellent with my servers providing extra details on the menu & drink options!  Will return to try some of the Mains!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Crispy Haggis
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Parmesan &amp; Truffle Chips-amazing!
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Smoked Fish Board (small)

qL6SJqsWcAt9bW1thHiwSw.text: You map app will help you find the entrance to this great restaurant. Look up for signage on the walls. We took a chance they could seat us for dinner. They were quite busy but happily found us. The food was excellent and service was great. A must go when in Edinburgh.

9O93JAaq55SyIpauY2VJ-Q.text: This place is fantastic! It's a little hard to find as it's down a side street, Advocate Close, but once you arrive you're greeted in an amazing old building by a friendly staff and a creative menu with an extensive whiskey list. I had a drink off the menu, Fizz Me Now, which was refreshing and well balanced. My husband asked for something along the lines of an Old Fashioned and they delivered with a whiskey twist. After that, we described what we liked to drink and the bar tender, Will, surprised us with delicious concoctions. We had two more drinks and each was better than the last. Will also showed us the base spirit he used and described the flavor profile. Very helpful when navigating all the whiskey and gin Scotland has to offer! We also had the charcuterie board to snack on and it's one of the best I've had in long time. The cured and potted meat was great and the accoutrements were the perfect pair. Two relishes, one of capers and cornichon and another that had egg yolk and spicy peppers really made the plate. We shared a half board and that was the perfect snack for two. This place is a must go if you're ever in Edinburgh!

rje6XM-HwzHuWXQHoLjABg.text: We arrived around 2-3 in the afternoon and didn't have to wait for a table upstairs.   The staff was super friendly and recommended us dishes to try since we've never eaten in Edinburgh before.  We went for the Black Haggis, Fish and Chips, and the Picanha Steak.  It was our first time having black haggis and it was super delicious. The texture of the inside was grainy and the batter was super crisp and paired well together The salsa-like salad on the bottom had a good contrast in texture and the light flavor really went well with the haggis.   The fish and chips was okay. The piece of fried cod was quite large and  the portion size was generous. The batter was crispy and not too salty. The cod was flaky but didn't have much flavor. Since the tartar sauce wasn't too zingy and light in flavor, I think the cod should've had more seasoning. I think the chips really saved this dish. They're a thicker cut of fries (similar to steak fries).   The steak was really delicious and cooked perfectly. I think the whiskey dipping sauce they gave really complimented the natural smokiness of the steak. It wasn't too heavy or oily. I recommend getting the steak over the fish and chips as an entree.  Had a wonderful time eating at The Devil's Advocate and definitely recommend it to anyone who is visiting Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Black haggis

Z1RqfY6pH7xR6kY9KL39og.text: Spirits and the like: Excellent bar staff. Excellent selection. Perfect craftsmanship.  I was blown away and will absolutely be back to try the food menu.

tcgAsM0uxxF2adve41vCEg.text: I Read about this restaurant on Yelp before going to Edinburgh and decided to check it out. Best decision of the whole trip! This was by far the best place we ate during the whole trip. I had the duck confit leg and it was amazing. My wife had the lamb burger and I regret not getting it. Food was fantastic and the atmosphere was great.   If you visit Edinburgh, this place is a must have for lunch or dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Duck confit leg

zhgbyiaMYKcpiH3kV5JoVg.text: We wandered in here after touring the National Museum of Scotland - we were looking for a late lunch and this hit the spot! Thought it would be typical pub fare, but it certainly was not! Had a composed salad of heirloom tomatoes and courgette that looked like a piece of art. Even the fish & chips were elevated! Great beer & G&T's, too. Will return on our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Composed heirloom tomato &amp; courgette salad

7N7njXY1K6xQOVttLIXEnA.text: Definitely make a reservation.  A little pricey, but worth it.  I recommend the sirloin with the whiskey and peppercorn sauce.  Dip the fries in the sauce.

kBZ7SLqIMEMDgfLvxZvr1A.text: Had a fantastic dinner here. They were able to get us a table and we had a amazing dinner.  They needed the table for reservation so they moved us to a private booth downstairs to finish our wines. Highly recommend!

-iYr7f6F9fmtCOJ77zqohA.text: The location is great, the space is charming.  The food was excellent and good value.  The server was a bit off, but it was a late Sunday so likely just a bad day.  The whisky selection was terrific.  Something for everyone, in what could have been a tourist trap, due to location.  Very good find.

FtVWHQVaMms9FIQ68-7meA.text: Such a great find! We got the steak and a Orzo pasta dish. There was a whisky peppercorn sauce that came as an accompaniment which was mind blowing! The tempranillo great and the cardamom chocolate mousse was brilliant. We have to mention that the service was so wonderful at this place!

qMkP3dqifZbkAInJqtjS7w.text: Received such rudeness while inquiring if a table was available. Tourists to the area should be treated with respect.  Apparently a reservation is a necessity.

GzlrPvK3uKWOB_1Ye_ic7Q.text: Ambiance, food, drinks, service - they all deserve top marks. A piece of quiet smack in the middle of the bustle, I would describe this spot as trendy, but without the pretentiousness that can usually come with it.  The cocktails were artfully prepared. I tried 2, and each had flavor combinations I had never experienced before. Delish!  For dinner I had the courgette soup, and the rare roast beef salad, which had so many layers of flavor and texture. Really good stuff. And the dessert - this lemon concoction that was neither mousse, nor custard, but something so smooth and delightful, I can't even describe it. A great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. First time having eggs whites in a cocktail = lovely.
Photo of The Devil's Advocate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Down Advocate&#39;s Close

QLm2aLScCq6YBUdMfVFEkQ.text: Great selection of whiskeys.  I had the wood scotch sampler and was pretty amazed at how sweet and smooth each scotch was.  I am not a fan of smokey whiskey and only the glenmorangie had a touch of smoke.  The cheese & meat platter was also delicious.  Had everything I look for in a proper cheese plate (but would have been better with toasts rather than chunks if bread).  I will say that my waiter was going hard on the upsell which totally put me off.  He tried to sell me more whiskey after I drank my own sampler and made me wait about 20 minutes for the "scotch expert".  He also asked me if i wanted bread with my cheese plate.  I said of course but he failed to mention the plate already came with a good amount of bread!  I told him I didn't want it and he took it off the bill but I know that was a sneaky move and I did not appreciate it.  Don't try to trick me into ordering more stuff I won't eat. I am sure many feel bad and don't say anything.  He probably gets away with it because he is hot. Make a reservation, this place gets crowded.

nl84rvBcBEu-2mYsalPt-w.text: Being broke college students, my friends and I were hesitant about going here because it was a bit pricey for us. However, the food was fantastic. Definitely my favorite meal of the U.K. I ordered the ox cheek, and it was FAB. The most tender meat I've ever had in my life! The sauce and veggies that it came with were great too. Devil's Advocate had a good beer and wine selection as well, and the environment was really cool! The only reason that I'm not giving it 5 stars is that our waiter was not very friendly to us, and they took our food away too quickly like they were rushing us out even though the restaurant was empty.

z32H70B7Owd58Wvd0UVf6Q.text: The Devil's Advocate is a beautiful gastro pub situated in Edinburgh Old Town, hidden from the very public High Street / Royal Mile. We got a table for 4 and only one hour and fifteen minutes to order-eat-vacate... I went diesel with a Courgette Carpaccio, heritage tomato, buffalo mozzarella & olive vinaigrette and a portion of Straw Chips. As you can see in the pics attached the starter size was smaller than the title itself...So, yes, it was tasty, healthy and minuscule... My friends ordered the Tweed Valley Beef Burger & the Teriyaki Salmon, both (taste-wise) on the satisfactory side of the scale. The service was friendly but a bit amateurish as the waiter-dude almost dropped a 33cl bottle of sparkling water on us from his unstable tray (he managed to catch it in time, though) and when we got the bill they add the wrong glass of wine which was  3 dearer than the one that my mate got. We pointed that out and the bill was kindly corrected by waitress Nastassia. Pros: handsome stone & wooden interiors, lovely atmosphere, cool food menu and friendly service. Cons: Expensive; considering the portion sizes/price ratio. Wouldn't mind to go for an encore... And yes; we managed to free the table before 14:15...

zuS2uwptipstewBaIHtnaw.text: Authentic and old atmosphere - highly recommend!!  Food was excellent, whiskey selection was substantial, and the vibe was what I was looking for. The lamb was perfect and every appetizer we had I would order again. Thanks Yelp - wouldn't have found this place without you. ;)

jOC6vC-W1lNPwD4sbtFT1Q.text: Awesome spot.  First...you gotta find it.  I won't tell you how to get to it, but once you do...it's sick.  Tasty cocktails, dope ambiance and architecture.  Bartender that really knows how to entertain and accommodate your drink taste preferences.  Totally awesome.
